review.reviewText: The staff is great and hotel is beautiful.  We had a great time.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Yes, it really was a great hotel and the entire staff that we experienced were all very pleasant and eager to assist. They made you feel "Important"

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: A great hotel.  Wonderful location, great staff.  Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Awsome hotel near union square.
review.reviewText: Our second time staying here, again no complains. Beautiful hotel rooms and extremely helpful staff, perfect spot near union square walking distance to great breakfast lunch amd dinner spots. We will be back again next year.

review.title: Hotel nice but the staff not very accommodating
review.reviewText: Has an issue with laundry service and was overcharged ridiculous rates and would not accomadate

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: Great location and excellent service from bellman, valet and front desk staff. The complimentary sangria was a nice touch. Parking is very expensive with $64 plus $8 plus in taxes.

review.title: Poorly managed
review.reviewText:
Some staff members were extremely unaccommodating
Parking was well overpriced
Amenities were weak

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Quick check in and check out. Room is very comfortable, huge bathroom with separate bath and shower. The room looks new and big. Beds are very comfortable. Air conditions are quiet (very important to us). The staffs at front desk and bellmen are all very helpful and trying hard to help. Location is excellent. There is an independent owned parking garage across the street if you care to save $20 with in and out  privilege .  We will definitely choose this hotel in our future trip.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: Poor service throughout property from check in to check out - including valet' reception and restaurant.
Overall very nice hotel. Friendly staff. Great location.
Everything was great!  Comfortable room and location.

review.title: Perfect location.
review.reviewText:
Our concierge Darlene was excellent, very informative, recommended a lot of activities for us to do. 
She was a great help.

review.title: Nice and Clean Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly, room was clean, and the experience overall was well worth the money. The only complaint I had was on the Valet Parking price of $75 for one night, but that's the City for you.  Hotel is within walking distance of Union Square which is definitely a plus!
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper Parking?  A girl can wish, can't she?
review.locationRemarks: Next to union square. Within walking distance

review.title: The Heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Shopping, eating at good restaurants,drinking coffee at cafes,walking in the Parks,visiting an awesome California  Science Academy Museum, wine tasting in Napa and Sonoma, and sailing in the Bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is great! Walk to shopping, good restaurants, cafes, Park, and Museums, Convenient to Trolley,Buses, Bart, taxi, and private car.

review.reviewText: Excellent location a block away from Union Square.

review.title: in heart of union square area and downtown
review.reviewText: hotel is very close to all key shopping and downtown amenities like the Museum of Modern Art.  Surrounded by many great  eating establishments
review.positiveRemarks: very close, nice layout and nice fitness center.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms might be ready for updating
review.locationRemarks: anything is available you'd like; shopping, museums, dining, drinking and theater.

review.title: Great Hotel, very friendly staff
review.reviewText: The location was perfect for our stay. Close to all public transportation. Cable Cars, Union Square, great shopping, entertainment all within a couple blocks. Hotel staff very attentive to our needs. Could not have had a better experience. We were on the 19th floor great view. Elevators were always just seconds away. Will use this hotel again.
Very nice hotel with a great location near Union Square.

review.title: Comfortable, great staff, beautiful rooms.
review.reviewText:
Loved everything BUT the late night noise echoing up from the 3rd floor bar.
Great bar, drinks, food!
Room doors either need a noise barrier, available bathroom fan or some sort of white noise option to block the people noise from the 3rd floor.

review.title: Sunday night get away
review.reviewText: They gave me a smaller room then I paid for because I did not want to be in a room that had previously had pets. Disappointed I could not have the room I paid for just because I do not want to be in a room where people bring pets. The bed was hard and uncomfortable. They had a mini refrigerator and charged $7 for a can of soda. $3 maybe $4 for this would have been ok but $7 is ridiculous. Parking cost over $60 just to park in the hotel. When we went to breakfast the waiter gave us orange juice once and did not check on us at all after that. The rest of the staff was nice but I expected way more for the price I paid for such a small room. I paid for a room with a few and ended up with a view of the hotel across the street and not the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The purified room was nice but there should be more then 1 floor of these rooms.

review.title: Nice Hotel in the Heart of SF
review.reviewText:
Overall this hotel was great! The hotel and rooms are well kept, the beds are comfortable, and there's a lot of fun activities within walking distance. 

I did have a few issues with the staff. The first issue was very minor. I asked the bell hop for directions and he told me to take a right when I should have gone left. Luckily, I knew my way enough that it wasn't an issue. The second issue was with the concierge. She wasn't a pleasant person in general and wasn't very good at her job. I attempted to book three reservations through the concierge. The first restaurant she sent us was a tourist trap (may have well sent me to the Rainforest Cafe). The second place had terrible reviews on Yelp so we did not honor the reservation. Finally, she botched the last reservation we asked her to make. After taking about a $60 cab ride to Cliff House we discovered she had booked us for the main restaurant and not for the brunch. When talking to her we were very specific we wanted the brunch. 

In summary... This hotel is fantastic, but my recommendation is to just use Yelp or plan your own way. Don't rely on the concierge!
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were out of this world. Best sleep I've had in a hotel in some time!
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Warf, Golden Gate Bridge, China Town, North Beach, and so much more

review.title: Comfortable and very good location
review.reviewText:
Bed and pillows were very comfortable, the room was big and clean, friendly staff, great lobby bar with live music and an excellent location.
The only negative comment I have (I believe it was an unfortunate event) is that 2 of 4 elevators were broken during my stay and from the remaining 2, 1 was being used exclusively for a private party this one night. That made us and other people wait for more than 15 minutes to go down when we had dinner reservations.

The front desk staff at check-in are super pleasant and efficient. The breakfast service in the restaurant last Thursday was superb. The bellman at the door actually asked me how my day was!  I loved that!  Generally, I prefer the Westin--but not in San Fran...loved my super-huge room and the staff and I'm picky!
Great location nice hotel in good area 1 block from Union Square

review.title: Not so good
review.reviewText: This hotel looks ok but there are a few things amiss. For instance, no coffe in the rooms. There is an espresso maker that will drop a 4 ounce espresso, however, ours did not work. The showers are tiny, there is no extra space in the mini fridge for your own items (and charges are automatically applied to your bill based on weight), you have to order ice (so you need to tip), the concierge booked us dinner reservations without any questions about preferences (likes, price range, etc), and breakfast for $30 means waiting in a 20-45 minute line to be seated for a buffet. Oh, they took our towels but didn't replace them, and I noticed once I got out of the shower. Overall not a great experience.

review.title: Don't book!
review.reviewText: Overpriced dissappointing hotel. Check in takes about 30 mins, room not ready at the time promised, that adds another 30 mins to check in

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText:
It was a good stay! Ill be coming back soon for sure!
Thanks!

review.title: Good location.....air conditioning system noisy
review.reviewText: They charged me 2 bucks for a banana which is stupid

review.title: Great hotel located close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: This is our second time staying at the JW Marriot.  We are a family of 4.  Rooms are nice size and stylishly decorated.  Bathrooms have a huge tub and separate shower.  There is a nice gym that my husband used during our stay.  There is free coffee in the lobby every morning.  The food is on the pricey side.  The only meal we ate was the breakfast buffet which is really good and worth the money.  The staff are really friendly and helpful.  The guest service desk is really helpful with providing a map of the city and giving us suggestions on where to eat, visit, etc.  I plan to stay there again the next time we are in San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel next to union square
review.reviewText: Very nice as you would expect a Marriott to be. Close to lots of shops and restaurants. Very nice. Highly recommend this to Hotel to anyone.
The staff is very service oriented.  Impressive accommodations.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Great stay, great location. Our room was very comfy. Bed, bath, and shower was great. We were on the 8th floor but elevator worked just fine, not slow. My only complaint I don't think is Marriott fault, just San Francisco in general. Noisy streets all day and night. And valet parking was stupid expensive. Knowing what I know now, I still recommend this hotel for the overall experience.  I would uber everywhere and not have a car til I leave the area.

review.title: Very nice perfect location
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Very well kept hotel. The valet parking with their own underground parking and arival parking is great. No parking in the street then having your car driven to a public parking garage. The valet guys are great and very fast with any need. We have stayed here many times. Always a 10

review.title: Great place in the heart of the city.
review.reviewText: Had a great stay during Fleet Week. Right in the middle and accessible to all the transportation. Hotel room was in great condition. It was right on Post street. It was a bit loud at night.
review.positiveRemarks: Service staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was modern.
review.negativeRemarks: Our TV was a bit blurry. Maybe it was the channel or the TV.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants and transportation options. Right near Chinatown.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: I spent a long weekend here on a girls trip and it was the perfect location! Hotel was top notch and the staff was informative and friendly. We were within walking distance from shopping, eating, theaters and the cable cars which will get you to where ever you want to visit.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: eating, shopping, theaters, cable cars, fishermans wharf, pier 39

review.title: nice hotel near union square walking distance perf
review.reviewText: hotel nice clean and room big service all was perfect
I had suite room but it was not worth to be suite.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with very friendly staff
review.reviewText: This was the first time we had stayed in SF, the hotel was in the perfect area for us to explore the city in walking distance. All the great shops and resturants surrounding the hotel made our stay at the hotel that much better. The hotel overall had freiendly helpful staff, beautiful clean rooms, they made you feel comfortable there. Asking for help and directions to where we should go for anything, the hotel staff provided you a map and a list of resturants that cane highly reccomend by the hotel. It specified if they were walking distance or if you needed a ride there. Just those little things and the staff being so helpful was GREAT.  When we make our returning trip to SF I would stay at this hotel again. Reccomend this place to everyone.

review.title: Nice hotel, convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very centrally located.The room size was decent even though showers were small. The concierge services were decent but almost had to dig for information.  The restaurant on level 3, food was decent but the service was poor.  We ate there everyday but the last three days, the buffet was missing the chef.  No fresh omelets or waffles.  Not a big issue but the hotel charged us the same amount for the buffet despite the lack of the chef station.  The last day we were there, the service was so horrible, I actually didn't want to pay the check.  I paid and even tipped despite my heart telling me differently.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and room size were positive.
review.negativeRemarks: Level 3 restaurant service
review.locationRemarks: Kokkari a few minutes away is the best Greek food in town.

review.title: The location was excellent
review.reviewText: The location was excellent. A couple blocks from great shopping, restaurants and small diners, four blocks away from trolley. The staff was excellent very helpful and attentive. We first checked in to a standard king guest room and it was just to small and no place for storing clothes with exception of closet. The room was dated and crayon on wall and tub was dirty no shower. We had to upgrade to junior suite because we we staying for five nights. The junior suite was much better. Very clean had shower and separate tub and lots of room to move around. We were on 6th floor so it was a little noisy at night.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great and the staff made it inviting.
review.negativeRemarks: A little dated and needs storage for clothing.
review.locationRemarks: The trolley was a few blocks away and only two blocks away from great shopping Saks, Nordstrom, Nike and the mall, and tons of eateries in area.

review.title: Could not even stay there
review.reviewText:
We got there staff was very friendly , when We got to our room it was old with very low quality furniture and very different from pictures.

We kindly asked the staff to cancel our reservation and they gave us Expedia ph number.

Impossible to cancel.

review.title: Best location ever
review.reviewText: Very convinience. Close to restaurant. Mall, park, and safety
I only spent one short night in the hotel, but everything was great. Staff was friendly and helpful and the executive lounge was very nice.
Everyone was very friendly and helpful.  Being this was my first time in San Francisco the concierge and lobby personnel were extremely helpful.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Centrally close to shopping, food and if you're a runner great hills and views.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our three day stay in this pleasant place
review.positiveRemarks: Good Hotel, Friendly Staff clean rooms, quiet, good mattresses,
review.negativeRemarks: Complementary coffee run out before 9:30 am, complementary wifi only on demand
review.locationRemarks: Good Location, Most of the attractions can be reached by Taxi within  10 Minutes or 30-40 Minutes walking

review.title: SF stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, however, the walls are thin and can hear evrything.
review.locationRemarks: Close to dinning and night clubs.

review.title: Close to Union Square and shops
review.reviewText:
Great hotel and ideally located for shopping. and Theatre.

Amazing lobby.

Breakfast is not over priced.
review.locationRemarks: Shop

review.title: Close to everything. . Great staff
review.reviewText: Arriving close to midnight a few things weren't 100% but we could fix them the next day. Would have loved a soft robe that wasn't XXL but that's the only size they come in.  Overall this hotel was a very good experience

review.title: Great hotel and very helpful staff
review.reviewText: Full marks for the staff at the front desk. Expedia had "misplaced" our reservations - or rather, there was no record of our booking in the JW Marriott reservation system. What could have been a long, tedious affair ended before it started: after trying to reach Expedia's customer support line without success, the JWM front desk staff offered us an equivalent package, no questions asked. In addition, the concierge staff at the JW was excellent as well - an recommended a beautiful and systematic stay in San Francisco with bookings at must-go places. Many thanks, JWM staff, it looks like we are going to be regulars at this hotel.

review.title: Great location for first visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent.  Polite and friendly staff.  Large rooms.  Perfect location for first visit to San Francisco.  Concierge as extremely helpful in exploring the city.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square. Shopping, Hop on-hop off bus tour, Wine Country tasting, bay cruises, local pubs and restaurants, Fisherman wharf, etc etc.

review.title: Very old and outdated hotel , good staff but needs
review.reviewText: To be renovated, central location but hotel and rooms are very old. Restaurant food was expensive but subpar.

review.title: Nice, close to the Union Square.
review.reviewText: Chinese parade was around the corner. Union square was only a block. All of the employees were extremely nice. The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was the bathroom stall needed  to have it's own room. I was in a  group of 3 and it wasn't the best experience when it came  to the bathroom.
This stay reminded me why we always look for a JW !

I thought this hotel was excellent. It was located near the shopping district. The staff was friendly and super professional. I would happily stay there again if I get another chance to visit San Francisco.

review.title: Marriott engages in absurd price gouging
review.reviewText: I didn't mind that my last-minute room reservation was very expensive, because there were two conferences in SF and hotel rooms were scarce.  Fair enough.  I did mind, however, when I came down for breakfast and the hotel was charging $59 plus a mandatory 18% tip for the run-of-the-mill Marriott breakfast buffet (about double what it usually costs, and about triple what it is actually worth).  I minded even more when I discovered Marriott was charging guests $60 to sit in a chair in the lobby (no, I'm not kidding), complete with a hostess on duty to enforce the fee.  When I noted the fees to the clerk on checking out (I wasn't even complaining, just pointing out it seemed over the top), he got snarky with me, informing me that it was "what the market would bear what with all the wealthy clients at the annual JP.Morgan Chase conference").  I visit SF a lot on business -- this was the last time I'll stay at a Marriott property there -- I'll leave them to their wealthy (but apparently stupid) patrons.

review.title: JW Marriott, a gem in the city.
review.reviewText: Overall, the stay at the JW Union Square was a great experience. The staff was great and very pleasant, and the property was immaculate. The front desk was able to provide early check-in and even gave us an upgrade to a city view room upon request! Having stayed at various 4/5 star hotels in the area, I am positive JW Marriott Union Square is one of the best. The only complaint would be the daily $10-16 Wifi fee. Although very fast and efficient, the high price tag was a turn off. Cheers
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi accessibility

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: My wife and I had a wonderful stay last night. Blanka at the front desk was so friendly and helpful. She quickly noticed how long of a travel day my wife and I had with our 3 month old and took great care of us.

review.title: great stay right off union square
review.reviewText:
our family of 3 had a wonderful stay at the j.w.marriott 12/17/12/19... we always stay in SF right before the holidays so we can go out to dinner in SF a couple of times w/o DUI worries and for the shopping

we have stayed a few other nice places in years past but i decided to try a different, less expensive hotel this year and was very surprised by how nice this hotel was...we will stay here again next year

the rooms were quiet...starbucks and peet's around the corner

they should give free wi-fi
review.positiveRemarks:
rooms were nice and clean

people were helpful

they could give free wi-fi

review.locationRemarks:
you are one block away from union square and all the shopping you could want,
4 blocks from chinatown and a taxi away from the best restaurants.

review.title: Everyone was so welcoming!
review.reviewText: Doormen, bell hops, front desk, (especially Steve), housekeeping, everyone says hello, or welcome!  Incredibly great training.  Nobody is lazy and are always standing by to help.  This was an incredible hotel experience.  Can't wait to go again and can't wait to spread the word about how great your hotel.  Bravo! Bravo! Bravo! Thank you so much!  As we say in Hawaii, "much Mahalo!"
review.positiveRemarks: Everything!  Room was incredibly comfortable and well designed.  Felt spacious and was very relaxing.  The bed and comforter were perfect!
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a single thing, except perhaps having the ice delivered upon check in.  It's a bit of a hassle to have to call for ice.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great!  Right up the street from Union Square, our favorite hang out!

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: Thanks you Rena for you kindness in planning our short time in SF

review.title: Nice hotel but not family friendly.
review.reviewText: This hotel has no pool which was a disappointment. Also, only 4 elevators led to long wait times especially if you were trying to roll on a stroller. The windows in the room opened easily which was a major safety issue with a 1&4 year old.

review.title: Clean rooms, ok location, bad check-in experience
review.reviewText:
The hotel is within walking distance to many places (though stay away from the Tenderloin District at night unless you like seeing a ton of homeless and crazy people).

Check-in was the only rough part of my stay.  I reserved a king bed room through Expedia.com.  After we got checked in and got into our room, we found we had two queen beds instead.  I went back to the desk and said she made a mistake with our room and it wasn't what I had requested.  She said you guys don't often get the correct room information from booking websites (which, if true, should be fixed as soon as possible).  She said we were in luck, and she had one king room available and gave us your last one.

A traveling companion also requested a king room, but reserved through your website.  She, too, got a room with two queen beds instead of a king.  I felt bad for her and told her we were just given your last king room.  She went to talk to them anyway.  Same message was given to her about booking through a website, however the clerk had no explanation for it since the reservation was done through your website and not a third party.  To my and her surprise, she was given a king bed room.

I did not appreciate being lied to in my first stay with your hotel.  You clearly had extra king bed rooms available, and I suggest a review of your procedures and systems to prevent this from happening again.  I would stay at your hotel again to give you one more chance to prove this wasn't simply a "bad day".
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in experience needs improvement. It's the first thing people experience and it left a bad taste in my mouth.
review.locationRemarks: Location was only okay. A short walk away takes you to the Tenderloin district, which I didn't know was a really bad part of town, full of homeless.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: The service and all the staff were great. Thanks for all the help. Would go back again.
review.positiveRemarks: The whole experience from the doorman the housekeeping the concierge all was excellent
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe a newspaper
review.locationRemarks: Very central lots to do and see

review.reviewText: Very clean and nice. Staff was very attentive and helpful. Very classy hotel in the best location.
Very nice and the staff was excellent with large crowds. You still felt like you were important to them. I would recommend it!

review.title: A high end treat.
review.reviewText: We stay at top line hotels frequently but this was our first experience at a JW Marriott.  Could not have been much more pleasing.  Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms, luxurious bedding.  Could not ask for much more.  Would not have made this choice but for the rate offered by Expedia.  And, other gusts included the flight crew of the Blue Angels in town for fleet week!  Good chance to thank them for their service.
review.negativeRemarks: Door/bellmen not helpful in getting a cab at the curb.
review.locationRemarks: Great location 2 blocks from Union Square and theaters.

review.title: Great hotel close to shopping and nightlife!
review.reviewText: Went on a girls trip. Shopping a couple blocks away and easy to get everywhere. Safe area as well. Staff were amazing in helping us get anywhere and had great advice as to where to go. Great time, great hotel and friendly staff. Worth the dollars to stay somewhere nice, safe and it was quiet in our room during the night (no parties/street life heard from our room.)

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts. We appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We will share your message appropriately within Marriott.

Sincerely,
Nasser Mobarak
Director of Hotel Operations
JW Marriott San Francisco

review.title: OK Hotel
review.reviewText: It seems outdated. The overall interiors is nauseating to look down from upper floors. It may appeal to certain population, but not to younger population. Bathrooms are less functional as I expected.
review.negativeRemarks: Interiors
review.locationRemarks: Shopping is given since it's in Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel and good location
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice, staff was nice. The room was nice, not huge but decent. The bathroom was really nice except the shower was very small and lots of marks on the walls. The beds were comfortable, not many tv stations for kids which after a long day out it would have been nice to put on the Disney channel or something. We ate the hotel restaurant one night, I recommend eating outside the hotel, much better restaurants in the area within walking distance. I ordered a glass of chardonnay and without even asking me what kind the server brought me out the most expensive glass on the menu and it wasn't very good. That's why I asked her what kind of wine it was in which she hesitated to tell me since she knew she never asked me what kind I wanted which in my opinion it should have been the house wine. The hotel is in a great location right next to Union square and lots of shopping. The valet at the hotel is 66.00 tax incuded (SUV) and 55.00 non SUV. Right across the street is a public parking garage for half the price.
review.negativeRemarks: the marks on the walls, it didn't give the room a clean appearance. Bigger shower
review.locationRemarks: Great location, right in Union square where you can catch the double decker bus to fisherman's Wharf. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby.

review.title: Luxurious and comfy.
review.reviewText: This was a mini-stay-cation. We stayed in a junior suite--it was roomy and very, very comfortable. A nice splurge!

Everyone on staff eas exceptionally polite, professional, helpful and accomodating.  I would tecommend this hotel to everyone.  We had a wonderful trip in no small part because of this positive experience.

review.title: very accommodating staff
review.reviewText: First rate service by an experienced stand knowledgeable staff. Do not expect to be checked in before 1 pm. Rooms are very comfortable and the bathroom was well lit.
review.locationRemarks: Fabulous location with great restaurants and shopping within a few blocks

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel.  Restaurant was surprisingly good for a hotel.  Had one of the better steaks I have had in some time.

review.title: Great hotel and great service!
review.reviewText: The Hotel staff and rooms are great.  Parking is $56/ night, so I parked directly across the street in a garage for half the cost.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower parking rates

review.title: Nice hotel, Bad service
review.reviewText:
I didn't expect much on hotel service usually. I just expect what I pay for and that translates to cheap hotel, I expect no service and with 4 start hotel like this, I expect more.

To make a long story short, basically I didn't get what I paid for. I paid extra for two beds room and they put me in a single bed room with a VIEW. When we asked for two beds like we paid for, we had to jump through the hoops to get it. I wrote a lengthy review on trip advisor and to add salt to the wound, the hotel replied and they wanted to regain my trust without a one word of apology or explanation of what happened.

I am really disappointed and I think i got a better customer service at Red Roof.

Good thing about hotel? the room was nice, not spectacular and the location was superb. Employees were generally nice.
review.negativeRemarks: False advertisement on expedia about the parking fees. It was increased they say but on the website it was not updated.

review.reviewText: Very good place to stay. Close to Union square and shopping. Staff was very accommodating.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: great rooms, front desk service was not as good. Great location as you can walk to rest and bars

review.title: Nice hotel with comfortable bed
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in union square. Good location. We LOVED the bed. Very comfortable. The staff was friendly, however, we booked on expedia and thought wifi was included. It was not and it was $16 per day. That was the only negative really. We felt for as much as we paid for the room, wifi should be included. Other than that, great stay! Would stay there again.

review.title: Superb location, great staff and will stay again!
review.reviewText:
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at JW Marriott-Union Square, its such a GREAT LOCATION. Very central and the staff was exceptionally helpful, pleasant and really overall fantastic. I felt very welcomed, and the facility was superb.

We enjoyed the concierge lounge on the 21st floor and we didn't even pay for this extra service but we got it, and we had breakfast, and hot snacks (very nice) in the early evenings 5 PM, and then dessert at 7. Gosh we saved some money just eating there and enjoying the hotel. We had the most comfortable bed I"ve ever slept in at a hotel, and the pillows were just amazing...I literally was so comfy I fell right to sleep and it was hard to leave this hotel..I will definitely stay there again. The room was not too large, but the bathroom was awesome. its a full size tub, literally you can stretch all the way out laying down and the separate shower was well done as well... we had a late lunch yesterday at the restaurant on the 3rd floor and had fresh halibut and fish tacos and it was delicious and reasonably priced. You can walk out of your hotel and stroll to so many different locations conveniently...its really the best location!!
review.positiveRemarks: Superb location, extremely comfortable bed and pillows, lovely full bathtub and nice shower, exceptional staff and would definitely stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: I really don't have anything to add. Very nicely Done JW Marriott!!
review.locationRemarks: bike rentals steps away, union square and chinatown all walking distance

managementResponses.response:
Dear Accomplished Guest,

On behalf of the staff, please accept our apologies for the unsatisfactory experience. We take great pride in ensuring our guests satisfaction. Rest assured the items you have pointed out will be addressed immediately to prevent it from reoccurring. I would like to have your name and your date of stay to note in our system.

Thank you again for your input. If there is anything more I can do to win your confidence, please do not hesitate to let me know.

Respectfully,

Nasser Mobarak
Director of Hotel Operations
Email: nasser.mobarak@marriott.com
Direct: 415.929.2088

review.title: Just average, try someplace else
review.reviewText: Overall just average..front desk was not very friendly when inquiring about Union Square, shower is the smallest shower I have ever seen in a bathroom (maybe 2 x 2) and then they have the nerve to charge tax on a $56 1 day valet fee.

review.title: Nice room nice service
review.reviewText:
Room very clean staff very good
I will give hotel 5 star

review.title: Good location but definitely not a luxury stay!
review.reviewText:
- room bedding was dirty
- bathroom was not stocked with enough towels and was not cleaned well
- dirty glasses were not taken out and replaced with clean ones
- i booked a room with two beds and when we checked in the room had one bed and a pullout!

I would not recommend this hotel and overall had a very disappointing stay!

review.title: Clean & near Union Square and Transportation
review.reviewText:
Hotel was great with the exception of the ADA bathroom, we had to rig the bath to take a shower but other than that it was a good stay.
On another note, just about SF, make sure you bring layers to wear, it gets windy and cold, to warm and hot. No need to bring an umbrella, should it rain (hardly does), there is an umbrella in the closet.
review.negativeRemarks: Save ADA rooms for handicapped only
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is 2 blocks as well as the Trolley and BART

review.title: Very disappointed
review.reviewText: Unbelievable that being the hotel it is suppose to be, the restaurant has a terrible menu, the rooms have absolutely NO space to put things away, Concierge needs more experience in recommending places to go. It took us like half an hour to have a bell boy to help with suitcases at checkout time because they only had one at that moment.
review.positiveRemarks: Very well situated and beds are confortable
review.negativeRemarks: The menu and the kitchen and the distribution of the room

review.title: Nice -- enjoyed our stay
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights at the J.W. Marriott. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bellmen were also helpful. The room was nice. The hotel itself was also very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Amenities were very expensive. My wife ate two candy bars from the room. That was a $16.00 mistake. The overnight parking charge was also costly.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance from Union square and Chinatown. Near cable cars. Walgreens around the corner. Buy your candy bars there instead of room mini bar.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the location and easy access to everything, shopping, restaurants, activities.
review.positiveRemarks: Very very nice bathroom - lots of space and modern clean look
review.negativeRemarks: the room telephone didn't work so we had to use a cell phone to call for room service
review.locationRemarks: Farallon Restaurant - less than one block away - perhaps the best seafood I have ever had.Beautiful unique dcor. A really special dining experience

review.reviewText:
Good place, everything is around. the hotel was good,
the most im gona miss is the great breakfast i had for the two night i stayed there.

review.title: PLAIN
review.reviewText: The room is spacious and clean, however, the bathroom is really small and the shampoo and lotion are really not good to use, smells okay but the texture's weird for me. It's loud cause our room's by the street on 11th floor. This is the first time I visit SF and the first time I lived in a Marriott hotel. The hotel is generally okay, however I will go back to Hilton's brand that I always choose to stay previously, for a better price and better service.

review.title: Impressive customer service!
review.reviewText: Amazing customer service. Very friendly staff. Room service was always on time, and the food was excellent! Beautiful room. Bathrooms were especially well decorated.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendliness of the staff sticks out in my mind. They really added a special component to our visit. Rooms were beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing I can say is that the water in the shower would not get hot enough for my preference. The bed was a little too firm.
review.locationRemarks: We parked our car at the hotel's valet parking and used the public transportation system to get around. Easy walk to any bus stop. Giants' game ...

review.title: High end, reasonable hotel at Union Square
review.reviewText: The food was very good and above average for the convenience of hotel food; however, incredible options are available within a few blocks!
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were very comfortable and well appointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Published hotel ice machine locations.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of High end shopping is located in Union Square area: Saks, Neiman Marcus, LV, Gucci, Prada, Chanel, Mulberry, and Tiffany---just to name a few!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square in SF
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel within walking distance of many iconic places in SF. Close to Union Square. Walking to offices off of Market were not a problem at all. Personally I expected a bit more from a JW Marriott after having experienced JW in Las Vegas. This is Marriott's top of the line, but somehow it didn't quite meet my full expectations of the room size and the full service. In fact on 2 consecutive nights late night parties next door kept me awake quite late. Don't get this wrong - this is a great hotel in a great location in a very pricey city. But for the price per night, I expected bit more in terms of service and quality of the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, decent views of the city, decent restaurant on site.
review.negativeRemarks: Room quality (more privacy) - the walls seemed to be too thin.

review.title: Very nice Hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had a very nice stay at the hotel. It's location is great for visiting San Francisco. The hotel is very clean and the staff was excellent.

review.title: Great location right in Union Square downtown.
review.reviewText: Location was perfect, close to all the shops and cable cars, etc. Staff was incredibly helpful and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again. Room was clean, good sized, and very comfortable.

review.title: Nice hotel. Great location.
review.reviewText: One block from Union Square. Very conveinent. Just wish the parking was not so expensive when staying at the hotel.

review.title: Valentine's Day Weekend 2014
review.reviewText: The hotel staff and parking attendants welcomed us very warmly. The lobby is beautifully appointed. The elevators are super fast! - we had a lot of fun with that especially because the building is very tall and you can see down to the lobby from the top floor. We were on the 11th floor and had a beautiful view of the city. The room was well appointed, very clean and the tub / shower was very tidy and roomy. There's a Walgreens nearby if you need it and Lori's Diner is right around the corner - it's open 24/7 and has great food.

review.title: Business in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great central downtown location. You can walk to anything and there are lots of great restaurants and other services nearby, including shopping at Union Square. Rooms are nice and big and have all the necessary amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed, quiet and well appointed. Nice big bathrooms, with tub, separate shower and great guest amentities (soaps, etc.)
review.negativeRemarks: The valet service was not great and the iron provided in the room was well, terrible. It leaked water all over and was cheap.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurants, bars, etc all very close by.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with a great atmosphere
review.reviewText: Gorgeous hotel with beautiful design. I would highly recommend to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the culture and the design.
review.negativeRemarks: The gym was shut down for renovations
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of downtown.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: The location was great and the staff was very helpful and nice, especially Ally at the concierge desk.
review.negativeRemarks: the room service didn't do a great job. We expected more from JW Marriott
review.locationRemarks: It's very close to Union square and there are so many nice restaurants and store you can just walk to within minutes.

review.title: Great location, nice and new, reasonarble rates
review.reviewText: I loved the 3rd floor lounge area. Very pretty and welcoming. We had wine by the fire place across from the bar. Ended up back after dinner, playing board games till 1 pm!
review.negativeRemarks: If you can instal few heaters outside, where the coaches are across the valet!
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, and night clubs very close by. All walking distance

review.title: Nice hotel close to shopping.
review.reviewText: Good experience, good location. If you want to shopping, this is good choice.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping . Food.

review.reviewText: Excellent , friendly, helpful staff

review.title: Noisy rooms, intense food odors all over the place
review.reviewText: The rooms are not properly isolated so is hard to sleep with all the traffic and ambulances of San Francisco. Additionally, the main kitchen is locate in the Lobby Floor and all the odors go up to the entire building, particularly on Fridays and Saturdays.

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, close to all San Francisco attractions. Would highly recommend it.
review.positiveRemarks: Big room. Newly remodeled and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows... And would be awesome if they had a bar at the top of the hotel that all patrons could use.
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square.

review.title: Modern hotel one block from Union Square
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Unusual to find such a great property close to Union Square as many downtown hotels in the area are older properties. Huge indoor atrium is very impressive. Lower Nob Hill side of the square, so away from the hussle of the Tenderloin and Market Street. Double rooms are good for families if you don't mind squeezing into 'double' bed. We stayed the weekend before Thanksgiving and the rates were reasonable for the area. There is a indoor parking garage across the street which was about half the price of the hotel valet parking. We used the valet though for convenience.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern, beautifully decorated. Comfortable rooms with luxury bedding, separate bath and shower. Good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Room with 2 beds have two 'double' beds. Two queen beds would be more suitable for family of four.

review.title: Centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was good and I didn't hear the noise other reviewers wrote about. The room was comfortable and clean. Explore some of the restaurants on your own because the ones the concierge recommends are a little pricey. It did get a little to warm in the room at night and I was unable to control it. Staff were all friendly !

review.title: No marriot points when booking through expedia
review.reviewText: If you are a part of marriot's reward program you will not get points when you book through a 3rd party such Expedia

review.title: great location/accommodating staff
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful experience with the JW Marriott at Union Square. The location was ideal for some of the things we wanted to do in San Francisco. The room was spacious, clean and well designed. The bath and shower were apart and separated by a wall to provide quiet in the room while using a hair dryer or taking a shower. The hotel bar/restaurant was fun and convenient. All the staff we encountered in our week's stay treated us like we were the only guests.
review.negativeRemarks: the towels were a little worn, but, I think it is more enviromentally friendly to use perfectly fine towels instead of replacing them at the first sig
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf ... lots of cool and exciting activities

review.title: AVERAGE HOTEL, MASQUARADING AS A LUXURY HOTEL
review.reviewText: The outside, lobby, elevator and price give the impression of a high end, luxurious hotel, but the rooms and amenities are anything but. The rooms are small. The beds are narrower than true double beds. There were minimal drawers to place clothing, so we had to live directly out of our suitcases. There was no spa, swimming pool, or cafes (there was an expensive restraurant with a limited menu.)
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby with interesting artwork, fun and rapid elevators, pleasant front desk and valet staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Increase width of double beds. Even a few inches would make a difference. Increase storage place for clothing. Four towels per room
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square. We came for the Women's Marathan and we were very close to the starting line. Excellent shopping nearby.

review.title: Nice Hotel Near Union Square
review.reviewText: I had a great time in San Francisco. As we arrived to the hotel the staff of the hotel greeted us, we dropped are luggage in are room; and later went for a walk in Union Square. the next day we went to the Golden Gate which was really great, and in are last day we went to Alcatraz. For the Alcatraz tour you have to book the tour a week in advance, because it's usually full.
review.positiveRemarks: That its next to Union Square, and the hotel staff are really friendly and honest.
review.negativeRemarks: Renew Rooms
review.locationRemarks: Go to Golden Gate, Alcatraz, and walk in Union square.

review.title: Quality hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: The JW Marriot is a fine hotel in Union Square. We had a panoramic view of the City outside of our room on the 17th Floor, from nearby Market Street, to across the bay and around to Sutro Tower to the west. The staff of the Marriott was more than pleasant and eager to make our stay both memorable and perfect. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting the perfect experience of staying in the heart of the City, whether for a week or a day.
review.positiveRemarks: The room amenities were stylish and appealing from the toiletries to the wall art and the halogen reading lights over the gorgeous king sized bed.
review.negativeRemarks: It's a perfect hotel, except for the fact that you can only enter from a congested 1-way street (Mason)
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square and one block from the Theater District--lots of great restaurants in the immediate vicinity!

review.title: Business trip
review.reviewText: One night stay for a quick business trip and all was excellent. Upgraded to a great city view room by very nice front desk staff!
review.positiveRemarks: Center of the city, accessible to many of San Francisco sites. Friendly staff, very great service. Hotel is very nice and contemporary looking.

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location, just 2 blocks from Union Sq.
review.negativeRemarks: Did have quite a bit of street noise, even on the 18th floor

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText:
I never write reviews mainly because I am Very critical and usually find something to moan about but this hotel was pretty impressive!

Our initial room was on the 8th floor which I found too noisy with the road noise outside (hotel
Is right in center of San Fran) so I asked to be moved which staff were more than happy to accommodate.

The staff can't do enough for you, the rooms are big light and comfy especially
The beds which are huge and not too hard!

Only critism was no free wifi and food was expensive although it was very nice - the breakfast of toast and fruit buffet made a welcome change from pancakes.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi should be standard
review.locationRemarks: There is huge shopping centre 10 mins down the road, mason cafe is cheapest and nicest for breakfast. Catch cable car on market street to fishermans

review.title: Nice Hotel near to Union Square.
review.reviewText: It was really a great experience staying here. The staff was really good and attentive. The hotel was very clean. It is also well situated in San Francisco near to all the happening places and good food joints. You gave a variety of options to choose from like Thai, Indian, Japanese Sushi bars, and the conventional local food. One can enjoy the Cable car ride as the starting point of the cable cars is pretty nearby. Also a good option to stay in case you are traveling for a conference hosted in Moscone center. Overall an excellent option for a comfortable stay in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The food options in the Level III restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Already mentioned in the experience. However you can add Chinatown as a nearby place for shopping.

review.title: accessible to many areas
review.reviewText: Pleasant stay. Too much smoking outside hotel. People were not abiding by laws.
review.negativeRemarks: Smoking areas
review.locationRemarks: Sightseeing and restaurants

review.title: First class hotel in a great area.
review.reviewText: I would recommend your hotel as we had excellent service. I liked being able to call 0 and reach a person to help me with what ever I needed. Thanks so much for a wonderful stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The front desk being on 3rd floor so people could not just walk in off the street.
review.locationRemarks: It was a great location, near Union Square .

review.title: Unimpressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is overall nice, especially the lobby, but when paying a premium for a luxury hotel, I expect something more than a small room with a lumpy bed, bland furnishings, and a view of a wall.

review.title: Extremely nice hotel right on Union Square
review.reviewText: The bustling city is right outside the door! Plenty of shopping, food, and entertainment around! This hotel is extremely nice, with beautiful dcor and a helpful staff - especially for out of town tourists! They will help in every possible way. The rooms are large and beds are extremely comfortable. The bathroom is extravagant, beautiful, and easy to get ready for your night on the town in! Use this hotel if you're wanting to stay in the middle of the crazy city, yet come home to comfort!

review.title: Fitness Center & Room Service
review.reviewText: The exercise facility was well equipped and large enough to meet fitness needs. Room service was prompt and courteous, but in my view just a bit pricey.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel personnel were courteous, helpful and not pushy for tips.
review.negativeRemarks: The digital display on the elevators indicating what floor had been reached was at times difficult to read.
review.locationRemarks: No opinion. I was in San Francisco to work and unfortunately that's all I was able to do.

review.title: NIce hotel near/at Union Station
review.reviewText: Extremely polite valet, attendants, staff, housekeeping and everyone else dealt with on hotel staff
review.negativeRemarks: A more thorough preparation of room prior to check-in, MM's on floor and not vacuumed near refrigerator
review.locationRemarks: Great location with easy access to and from local walking distance sites and Fwy

review.title: Centrally Located
review.reviewText: Our stay was very nice, overall, This hotel is centrally located to all the shopping and restaurants. You can just walk to almost everything. The hotel is very clean and maybe a tiny bit dated from the outside but nothing too ugly. I, too, read the reviews before I booked my hotel and everything everybody else sais was really accurate. The one thing that indeed stood out the most at this hotel was THE STAFF. They were all excellent!!!!! From the doormen to the cleaning staff. If you need the CONCIERGE---you must ask for RIDO. He was extremely helpful and charming.
review.negativeRemarks: The one thing I did not like was that I could hear the occupants next to me closing and opening doors.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great! Rido(the concierge)recommended Sears for breakfast and I do too. The Walgreen's on Powell Street is stocked with everything.

review.title: Hotel in a good location for shopping.
review.reviewText: Rooms where very nice and clean. Concierge service was very helpful and friendly. The restaurant they recommend where all very good. Also the food at the restaurant in the hotel was very good. We had a lunch and 2 breakfast. Food and service was exceptional.

review.title: You will not be disappointed
review.reviewText: The overall experience was excellent. I have stayed in dozens of hotels around the country and in other countries (and I live in Las Vegas and deal with strip hotels regularly). The cleanliness and comfortableness of the room was excellent; everything was fresh and clean, the room was well appointed and conducive to relaxation and there was no awkward laundry service smell to the bed linens. The staff was extremely helpful. I took my 9 year old daughter with me for her ninth birthday - so I booked a standard room. The only comment I have (more of a comment rather than a complaint) is that I felt like there was a seperate level of courtesy given to the different strata of room occupants. This is understandable, and I'm sure it always happens, but I shouldn't notice it. You know - hide it better. That being said, it was not bad and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone booking any level of room.

review.title: LOCATION
review.reviewText: Very pleasant experience and an easy hotel to access
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really
review.locationRemarks: Location is great. A block from Union Square and very easy for walking around

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice.. Great room.. Bar area.. Helpful staff.. Except for the Hertz people at the hotel... Could care less.. Can walk to a lot of places...
review.positiveRemarks: Location and very nice and classy..
review.negativeRemarks: Hertz rental car representative.. Not helpful.. No reason to have them there..
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown... Union square.. Lots of shopping and restaurants... Can take a taxi to Fishersman wharf...

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The location is in a perfect place of the city and all forms of transportation.
review.locationRemarks: great location near all forms of transportation and close to china town

review.title: Great Marriott Hotel & a Heavenly Bed!
review.reviewText:
We loved the JW Marriott at SFO!
The room was lovely, beautiful king side bed, most comfortable bed i have ever slept in!
Bathroom easy access. Room service was quick. Food was amazing! We had dine in room service.
Lots of outside noise, but I love to have the window open & that was a great asset!
We went to the SF Giants ball game, easy walking from the hotel thru the city shopping.
Loved it! Would recommend anyone stay here when in SFO.
review.positiveRemarks: Close proximity to Union Square & city shopping!
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Walk to Union Square, close to city shopping, right in the middle of everything!

review.title: great hotel for couples
review.reviewText: I like the hotel because its very clean, very comfort , and everything was a walking destine so that was very nice we get to enjoy our time just by walking around the neighborhood.

review.title: Great hotel overall
review.reviewText: Was in San Francisco on a business trip. Great hotel, staff, amenities. The location is unbeatable.

review.title: Great for family or business traveller
review.reviewText: Traditional JW quality, great location, comfortable, luxury. Nothing disappoints me, nothing surprises me either.
review.locationRemarks: 2 mins walk to union square

review.title: Great place to stay before Bay to Breakers
review.reviewText: Staff was wonderful and the front desk gave me great advice on my options to getting down to the starting line. The bellman arranged a cab for me and the morning was stress free.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and the buffer breakfast was very good.
review.negativeRemarks: We did have to request the roll away bed twice.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square and about a 1.5 mile walk down to the Ferry building.

review.title: Great option for a Union Square hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel option. Great location but not as much luxury one would expect from a JW.

review.title: Disappointing. Needs a renovation. Overpriced.
review.reviewText: Bed was old with a big dip in the middle. Had a sore back everyday I woke up. Water pressure in the shower and tub were both too low. Just really disappointing overall for what should be a 4 star hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is close to Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Bed. I had 2 doubles in my room and both of them were not comfortable to sleep on.
review.locationRemarks: Around union square but closer to the Tenderloin side. Be careful not to walk west of the hotel.

review.title: Would not recommend!
review.reviewText:
Disappointed not what I've come to expect from a JW Marriott property.
We will not stay there again!

review.title: Professional and classy
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel. The staff in particular were totally professional, friendly and helpful.Food and drinks were excellent especially the breakfast.Great position - just up from Union Square.
review.locationRemarks: Great - close to Union Square

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with friendly staff, delicious food, comfortable beds and walking distance to all major shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: NOISE FROM THE GENERATORS OUTSIDE OUR WINDOW.

review.title: Fantastic Stay
review.reviewText: The Hotel itself overall was outstanding, definitely will recommend others to stay at JW Marriott when staying in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Union Square-San Francisco

review.title: Happy hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. Great location. Valet parking a bit pricey but quick. Great bed.

review.title: Ok hotel if no other options.
review.reviewText: Rooms were small when you think of JW Marriott other facilities. Only 1 restaurant and no spa/pool facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: Room
review.locationRemarks: Great location, right in the heart of Union Square.

review.title: Would definitely return
review.reviewText: We were able to get an excellent pre-paid room price through Expedia, but the staff did not treat us as discounters. We received excellent service from check-in to check-out. My wife was impressed by the condition of the room, and the cleanliness of the room exceeded her expectations. The buffet breakfast was filled with selections that I enjoyed, and the price was not out of line. The bed and pillows were fresh and comfortable, with a large HD television within easy viewing distance. The only negative I can think of is that the room windows are only single pane, so street noise was not as filtered as I would like. The hotel has a great location, and if you love Italian food like I do, I strongly urge you to sample Fino restaurant, a two block walk west of the hotel. The pasta was superb, the wine list well chosen, all with reasonable prices.

review.title: Couples getaway
review.reviewText: Great staff. Very clean and comfortable rooms. The location is perfect for union square, cable car pickup or other activities.
review.negativeRemarks: View

review.title: Highly reccomended.
review.reviewText:
Highly reccomend this hotel. Fantastic location, great facilities, very clean and well maintained. Awesome views! Fitness centre was great.

Negatives - no free wifi.. and incredibly expensive room service but then again, that is pretty common. Take your money elsewhere and go eat out in this awesome city!
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: Great Hotel and better staff
review.reviewText: The service of the staff is incredible they are always willing to please you, my only problem is that we stayed for 5 night and there is not room ( drawers) to store your cloths.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough drawers
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Close to perfect.
review.reviewText: I would have liked the shower to be bigger. It was not as bad as a cruise ship capsule but close. Also the bathrooms could use brighter lights. But the service in general was fantastic. All employees were superb. The accomodations were top notch.
review.negativeRemarks: Small shower.

review.title: Surgesons
review.reviewText: Both the plugs for the bath and hand basin did not work. It was however fixed immediately on notification.

review.title: Fun place to stay.
review.reviewText: The whole place was very nice. A major turndown was the room could only down to 65 degrees, I was too hot at night. No free continental breakfast or in room wifi. For the price I think a meal or free wifi was called for. Expect $30 pp for breakfast and $14 a day wifi. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. Being in the middle of town it was easy and close to any resraut, club, and mall. Overall it was a great experience and would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The bathrooms were very fancy and done with a lot of detail.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed sheets were kind of rough and the lowest the thermostat would go was 65.
review.locationRemarks: Perfectly inside the city.

review.title: Good choice among many hotels in the neighborhood
review.reviewText: There are many hotels in this neighborhood - convenient for business and tourism. I am a regular Marriott customer so I picked this one. Clean and comfortable. My room was facing back side (nothing to look at.. neighboring buildings and exhaust ducts) which was not great but I just stayed/slept on my business trip so it did not bother me. Bathroom is clean and big. Bed is comfortable. TV and usable work desk. Bose radio. All worked for my business purpose. A/C worked ok. Not much to do in the hotel (I did not explore much but...) and the surrounding area towards south was not too great (I walked around looking for a convenience store) but if you take cab/car service, it should not matter. Also you can walk to Union Square in no time -- that would be nice if you have time to explore evenings. Over all it is a good hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: View from the room
review.locationRemarks: Convenient. Near Union Square.

review.title: Not recommended
review.reviewText:
The hotel room was small and had no space for clothes for a 4-night stay.
Wi-fi was not free in the room and was very slow in the lobby.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Location was perfect for us. We had lunch at the Daily Grill. We had Valentine's dinner at Fleur de Lys only two blocks away. Shopped at Union Square. All within very close walking distance. We will stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff friendliness and cleanliness of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square shopping.

review.title: It's a must
review.reviewText: Great location for tourists, Service in the hotelis great, they can't do enough for you.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Perfect fpr visitors

review.title: Marriott Value as Promised
review.reviewText: Everyrhing about this property was top-notch-location, spacious room, lovely bathroom and fabulous lobby. We were traveling with friends and especially appreciated the seating and attractive decor in the common areas. Close to Union Square.

review.title: Fantastic location. Great service. Nice property!
review.reviewText: Everything you expect from a Marriot. This was our 2nd time staying there and you can't beat the location. Within walking distance of everything you want to see, do and eat! Clean, quiet and nice upgrades from the regular Marriotts.

review.title: not bad
review.reviewText: the only bad things in the hotel is the room service

review.title: Great Hotel & Great Location
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel for one night and was very impressed. The service was great, the room was great, and the location was awesome. There were tons of nice shops and restaurants within walking distance. I will definitely stay again.

review.title: Marriott Union Square
review.reviewText: The staff at the front desk and in the restaurant were very helpful, friendly and went above and beyond what was expected to make my stay top notch.

review.title: San Francisco Layover
review.reviewText: Stayed at the JW Marriott for one night before catching a flight out the next day. The hotel was superbly located with lots of restaurants and shops in the neighborhood. It's also quite close to the Moscone center where a lot of conferences and conventions take place. Definitely well recommended.

review.title: PEOPLE PEOPLE PEOPLE
review.reviewText:
I'm just going to say one thing.
The People is very very good, kind ans really makes the difference.
They make you feel so good.
They are number one !!!

review.title: Would be hard pressed to return
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfectly "nice", perfectly "clean", but pretty dated-- rooms felt very circa 1986. Major issue for me, since I went to the hotel to settle in and work for three days: the food was truly horrible. Extremely limited in-room menu, and what was on it was close to inedible. And very overpriced. I ended up heading to the Ferry Building farmer's market, shopping, hauling it back to the room to have something decent at hand to eat. By the end of the second day, couldn't wait to check out.

review.title: Impressive Hotel! Best value for money! Highly Recommended!
review.reviewText:
Excellent service! Excellent ambience! Great value for money. Centrally located - close to many good shops, restaurants, and the beachfront. We stayed for six days and loved every minute of our stay. Spacious rooms and very good housekeeping. They have a push button service (literally in the room there is a button to press) to receive anything you want. They charge $12.95 per day for the Internet in the room, but you could use the business center or the lobby for free wireless service; you could also go to a few places nearby (Starbucks cafe and a few other cafes that provide free WiFi. We used Hertz for car rental on specific days. Booked the previous day through the concierge. They bring the car to the hotel and you may return the car by the end of the day (up to 10pm) at a Hertz location just one block from the hotel. You may avoid the car parking/garage charges of $40-55 per day/night in the area hotels. Hertz charges are reasonable - e.g., $40-60 per day depending on the size of car you want with GPS/NeverLost system. Very convenient!

JW Marriott has a great restaurant - $18 for buffet or a la carte breakfast. A full bar with a great ambience. The elevators have glass outer so you can see the hotel rooms and the lobby - somewhat like the Embassy Suites.

Recommend Kokkari Restaurant - the best Greek restaurant in the US, which is just a couple of miles from the hotel; walking distance.

review.title: Nice Hotel - would stay there again
review.reviewText: Spent 7 days in early June. Requested upper floor room to avoid street noise and received a room with a great view looking west - no tall buildings to obstruct view. Room was clean and staff were very accommodating. Hotel is one block from Union Square with fine dining and shopping within easy walking distance. Took public transit for Fishermans Wharf and other areas - very efficient system. One complaint though - on check in I inquired about the Visa gift card promotion advertised on Marriott website (you receive a $50 visa gift card when paying with a Visa card). Desk staff was not familiar with it and promised to get back to me, but never did. Somewhat disappointing in a hotel that prides itself on service. I forgot to bring it up again on checkout. Otherwise a very pleasant stay.

review.title: Great Hotel.
review.reviewText: Friendly attentive staff. Beautiful lobby. Nice room.

review.title: A Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: A great hotel that's centrally located near transportation, galleries, theatre, food and shopping. The entrance is on a slight incline but what do you expect in San Francisco? Attentive staff and tasty room service.

review.title: Marriott - San Francisco
review.reviewText: very nice

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: We went to the City for our 34th anniversary and our stay at the JW Marriott was excellent. Very friendly staff.

review.title: Can't wait to go back, but might want to check out another hotel for the experience.
review.reviewText: JW Marriot was great and the staff was very helpful.

review.title: Great Location and Good Value
review.reviewText: Very clean, modern rooms with comfortable beds and nice bathroom. The location is great, only a couple blocks from Union Square. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The next time I am back in San Francisco, ill be staying at this hotel. Everything went smoothly and i did not have one complaint the entire trip. Everything from the maids, to the concierge, to the bartenders were all respectful and quite helpful when we needed them. Will definitely visit SF and stay here again.

review.title: Looking for a good location!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel when you're inside, outside looks like a big block of concrete. But the location is great, you're nearly Union Square (shopping) and all public transportation are at a few minute from the hotel (BART Station, cable car, bus, streetcar).

review.title: Made the Trip Even Better
review.reviewText: Absolutely top-of-the-line hotel. Staff was extremely nice. Was upgraded and the room was spectacular with great views. Location was a huge plus...close to travel options and in the heart of it all. Highly Highly reccommend

review.title: Great location, but you have to pay for internet?
review.reviewText:
Hotel location was great, right close to Union Square, and close to transit. Took the BART in from SFO Airport and then it was about a five block walk from the station. Fairly handy. And I believe it was fairly central to all of San Fran's sites. Close to a cable car stop so you can hop on fairly easily without having to wait in a huge line at Market Street.

Oh ya, you have to pay for internet. Kinda surprised me, as in most places the wireless is free. Not a game changer, just a thorn in the foot.

review.title: Will definitely go back
review.reviewText: I had a three day stay at the JW Marriott, everything was excellent from room size, bed comfort, bathroom size, cleanliness and ammenities. You can ask for a refrigerator if you need it, and its complimentary. I did not try their food down stairs but there are plenty of places to eat within a block. Its in close proximity to Union Square, shopping, and bars. I felt the price was very reasonable for the value of the hotel and its services.

review.title: Great choice for us
review.reviewText: Two night stay in March 2010. 19th floor: what a beautiful view of the city! Chinatown was an easy walk away. My kids loved the glass elevator. Modern, clean, convenient, good service. We paid a LOT more in LA for an inferior room. Warning: like all big city hotels, be prepared for hefty parking fees

review.title: Visited my slacker brother and now am enivious of his lifestyle
review.reviewText: Everything was very nice and clean. The staff very courteous. The location central in the city. My only issue was the **** per day charge for the internet, which I avoided by visiting the Borders Books's cafe (around the block) every morning for breakfast and using their free wireless for my daily email check up.

review.title: I wish I could go back tomorrow!!!
review.reviewText: I had the best vacation with my son and his friend. My son would love to live in San Francisco. I thought it was the best city. It was just beautiful. We drove down the coast also and that was just wonderful. I wish I could go back again soon. The hotel was just great. We could not have asked for a more wonderful vacation.

review.title: Great location, clean and functional
review.reviewText: Great hotel, just what you expect from the Marriott brand. Nice clean, comfortable rooms, very well equipped. Fantastic location just one block from Union Square, but just away from the main noise. Hotel lacked a little atmosphere, but we din't spend too much time in there, so not a problem.

review.title: will go back
review.reviewText: nothing was wrong with the hotel, everything was great! i only had a problem with the fact that i was not given what I requested.

review.title: Our favorite SF Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice rooms, luxury bath and very attentive service.

review.title: San Francisco's best!
review.reviewText: We asked for late checkout. We got it. No questions asked. We had great recommendations from the hotel on places to eat and to go. Both the front desk clerks and concierge were very helpful. In fact, the entire staff is very friendly, the food is excellent, the rooms and common areas very clean, and the beds very comfortable. The location is good - just off Union Square and we walked nearly everywhere. We went to a wonderful musical, at the suggestion of the concierge, who arranged for our tickets. We would highly recommend this hotel to others. Can't wait to go back to San Francisco and stay at the JW!

review.title: Really Nice
review.reviewText: The JW Marriott is very nice. We arrived early but they were able to hold out baggage in a secure area until our room became available. The stay was very pleasant. The entire hotel has been redone so the rooms are all very modern and contemporary. The bed was heavenly! A few weird things.. Dont be fooled by the fancy ice bucket, you wont actually use it. There are no public ice machines located in the hotel, therefore you must flip your magic switch in order to have an attendant bring you ice. Also, the fridge like in many hotels is on a timer, dont dare touch anything in it or you will be charged after 15 seconds, I was however very pleased to find out they had extra refrigerators available for no additional cost. Just have them bring your fridge and ice at the same time! The bathrooms were very nice and all marble. Concierge was very helpful. I would say the only drawback would be the fact that there is no complimentary Wifi. We also had a problem with a somewhat expensive item we left behind in the room but the hotel claims to never have found. In the end, although dissapointing that there was some dishonesty, it is our fault for leaving it behind. Overall the hotel stay was excellent!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: We were very pleased by the good rates for such a beautiful hotel. It was very conveniently located for our New Year's Eve event. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in the Heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The JW Marriott is a short walk from Union Station. One block from Powell, the Trolleys, and the center of Union Square.We had a wonderful experience at the JW Marriott. The room was very clean and well maintained. The bathroom was large, and had everything we needed. We had a great view of the city on the 14th floor. You have to call to get ice, but the wait is very very short and no ice machine noise.The food was wonderful, and the staff very nice. Not one problem with our stay.We would stay here again.

review.title: Love San Francisco!
review.reviewText: I had a very wonderful stay at the JW Marriott. The hotel room was very comfortable. This hotel is in walking distance to restaurants and department stores. I loved visiting Fisherman Wharf! I hope to back to San Francisco really soon and I will being staying at JW Marriott.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My fiancee and I loved the hotel. Our only complaint was that we couldn't stay longer! Everything was perfect for us, and we loved every minute of our stay, even though it is pricey we thought it was worth it.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Great location.

review.title: great service
review.reviewText: I would stay in another JW Marriott

review.title: One of the best hotels in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay in this hotel. My wife and I loved it!!!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a really good location close to Union Square. It was undergoing construction while we were there which took away from the ambience. The restaurant was fabulous. First night we were there was a bachelorette party next door that was really noisy and we asked to be moved which they did with no hesitation. Would definately stay there again.

review.title: Lovely despite construction
review.reviewText: Hotel was going through some rennovations so they had tarps and scaffolding up. Other than that the room was comfortable, especially the bed, and clean. Only stayed 1 night but service at the desk and doorman was a good experience.

review.title: Good, but not THAT good
review.reviewText: In my opinion, this hotel s not worth the price. it's located on an excellent area, but the rooms and the feel of the hotel was oldish. also they were remodeling the exterior which gave it an unfinished look and shouldn't be like that or at least they should let you know.

review.title: Clean, comfortable, quiet.
review.reviewText: Very comfortable room with AC and ability to open window. Quiet, but conveniently close to Union Square. Excellent restaurants and fun Fringe Festival within walking distance. Why do smaller boutique hotels have free wireless access but the big chain hotels charge $12.95 per day?

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was very courteous and food was great.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location is just one block from Union Square, the staff is really great, and we love that the windows open for fresh air in the room. The rooms are nice. We've stayed here before and will be back.

review.title: Renovations
review.reviewText: Everything was great with this property. However I do think it's a good idea to let a person know if renovations are being done. The day we arrived it was extremely noisy with scaffolding and hammering in the elevator area.
