I do know that it's important to continuously upgrade and renovate; as I would want to stay in a hotel that did such. But still a good idea to let people know ahead of time. The remainder of our time we spent very little time in the hotel; so it was no problem. Thanks you.

review.title: Outstanding!
review.reviewText: Our first trip to San Francisco was phenomenal including our stay at the JW Marriott. The amenities, staffing, location, and general ambiance of professionalism and attention to guests' needs added significantly to a very memorable trip. San Francisco is an incredible place to visit; the JW Marriott just made it all perfect! Thank you and hope to return very soon!

review.title: Good hotel and great location
review.reviewText: Location was very good and room was very clean. Very comfortable. only a few inconveniences, ice not on floor and have to order room service, and they took 45 minutes for ice, no drawers to speak of in room for you clothes but nice closet.

review.title: Couldn't be happier
review.reviewText: The location was perfect, in the hub of transportation. The concierge was extremely pleasant and most helpful. Everyone bent over backwards to help make the trip a most enjoyable experience.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Typical hotel room. Only four stars. Only bad thing was that the shower door did not close. Outside was under construction.

review.title: Not impressed with the check in
review.reviewText: Initially, we booked a room with 2 double beds. They told me they do not have double beds in this hotel. I told them the reserv. was with 2 doubles. They said I will give you a King and a pull out couch. Not good. I asked to speak to a manager and then some way they found 2 double beds. I was not happy about that, but the hotel accom. were excellent. Thank you

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Excellent location, attentive staff, contemporary and comfortable ambiance! Overall a great experience!

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: The hotel atmosphere was pristine, modern, and trendy, which I did not expect of a JW Marriott. A good mix of business professionals, tourists, and families. I booked one room with double beds for four nights, and found the room to be spacious and comfortable. The best part was the bathroom...all marble tile (even the walls). Staff members were courteous and helpful. Location ideal - centrally located and within walking distance to great shopping and the Financial District.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great location in the heart of union square shopping district. very comfortable and clean rooms.

review.title: Great location very close to cable car and shopping too. I love my trip and I'll be coming back soon
review.reviewText: I love the hotel itself. Great customer service people are always happy when you get in and out of the hotel. Room service was the best and not to mention the house keeper made sure every thing was put in place and clean. But one little thing the bed was a little hard to like maybe if they where medium to firm it would of been good. It was just a little to soft for me. But yes I would tell people about the hotel and when I travel I try to stay at a JW they are the best.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Awesome bathrooms!

review.title: Good location.......
review.reviewText: Hotel service not that accomodating.

review.title: OK at less the a hundred dollars
review.reviewText: I am a loyal Marriott customer which is why I picked this hotel. I assumed the JW Marriott would be a premium hotel given that the JW Marriott was suppose to be their premium brand. The staff was indifferent and unhelpful and the room average at best. I would only pick this hotel at an extreme value. Otherwise, pick something else

review.title: ovae all it was great location and comfort. The staff was very helpful. The bed little uncomfortable
review.reviewText: Great....

review.title: Must see in person to appriciate, words just dont do it justice!
review.reviewText: Upon our arrival to the hotel we instantly felt pampered. While we checked in, the bellhop unloaded our luggage from the car and had it delivered to the room. Then,the valet parked our car in the hotels safe and secure garage. When we steped into our room, the view took our breath away!! We stayed on the 12th floor and had a corner room. The room was done in very nice colors, a simple contrasting wall in the foyer really set off the room. The only thing that we did not like about the hotel was the resturant, Level III. It was beautiful and the staff were extremly helpful but we are from Louisiana and the food was quite exotic for our taste. I could have eaten something but my husband would have gone hungry. There were many delicious resturants in the area surrounding the hotel so we had no trouble finding an alternative. We will stay again and again at this hotel on our return visits to this fun and exciting city.

review.title: Beautiful and comfortable
review.reviewText: Not much for writing these, but the hotel was absolutely excellent. Door staff was exceptional at getting us a cab even on early Sunday morning. It is extremely well situated. No noise, excellent.

review.title: Wonderful stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My mom and I stayed here for Memorial Day weekend. We LOVED the hotel!!! The room was comfortable and inviting. The staff were friendly and attentive. They answered all of our questions. The location was perfect, especially if you love to shop.

review.title: City view was not that great, but room was outstanding.
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay

review.title: enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: Very nice room, beautiful bathroom, easy walking distance from many great stores and restaurants including one of our favorites, Le Colonial. Excellent Cosmopolitans in the lobby bar.

review.title: Great bar, great service
review.reviewText: It has a really nice bar area downstairs...the concierge was very helpful...even printed out some clus that were in the area that would interest us.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very helpful and attentive. Any special requests we had (e.g., foam pillows) were met with a smile and an unbelievably fast turn around time. The restaurant in the hotel was great for a quick breakfast before hitting the airport on our way back. They also had a fun happy hour with the most attentive and friendly servers. The room was clean, large, and comfortable. I can't wait to go back!

review.title: Nice hotel but reservation problem
review.reviewText: The JW Marriott is very well located and comfortable but our experience was seriously compromised by learning when we checked in that there were no rooms with 2 beds available, which is what we had reserved. This seemed especially surprising since we were checking in at 5:00 pm, which does not seem an unusally late check-in time.

review.title: San Francisco is great! Bring a jacket.
review.reviewText: We ask for a corner room on an upper floor, the view of the city was fantastic.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Staff members are very friendly and professional. But after what seemed to beeing constant knocking at our door from staff for turn down service and housekeeping, my wife and I became annoyed. We searched our room for the privacy hang tag, but of course, our room didn't have one. I asked for one, but never got it. And by then our stay was almost over, so I didn't ask again. The shower situation was more annoying however. The shower curtain rod sits too low which makes the curtain itself hang down into the tub. The rod is not adjustable, so as you are showering, you can't help stepping all over the thing! Staff needs to work on keeping up with the trays left out in the hallway. Somedays, we noticed trays sitting out all day with trash and half eaten food on them. Gross!

review.title: would stay there again
review.reviewText: I have no complaints about this hotel. Beautiful clean,great location, elegant and great service

review.title: Modern, great service, great view
review.reviewText: The view from our room was spectacular. It is conveniently located walking distance to a lot of shops and restaurants, as well as the Muni and Bart. All of the hotel staff was very friendly. The bed wasn't the most comfortable and the shower had low water pressure, but overall it was a very nice stay.

review.title: A/C Problems
review.reviewText: Air conditioning did not work - They provide a heavy comforter which was too hot to use.

review.title: Always can count on consistent standards at Marriott
review.reviewText: Our stay was woderfull. My wife and I stayed for 4 nights on our Anniversary, and this was our jumping off point for touring the city. It was an excellent location right adjacent union square, probably the best place to stay and do the city. Lots of nice restaurants and shopping, and close to china town and north beach (we walked there 2-3 times). My wife can't wait to go back and have a weekend just to shop.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel with a great locations. I was scared to see how small the room was, because of comments that people make about the size of the rooms in San Francisco. But to our surprise the room was very nice and had a rather large bathroom. Make sure that you pack your walking shoes. My wife and I are in pretty good shape and we were worn out from the walking. Parking in the city is too expensive so if you can get by without a car, don't rent one. The transportation is very good for a big city. The Powell/Hyde Street Cable Car line runs through Union Square on a regular basis. Its 5 dollars to ride the car one-way. We ate at Neptune's Place at Pier 39 and had a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz. The food in San Francisco is a little pricey, but its very good. Make sure that you have some clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. Its excellent. Alcatraz is a must and if you are in shape.....bike across the Golden Gate bridge to Sausalito. The city is amazing and worth seeing. The Marriott hotel was excellent in every way and Union Square is the place to stay.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was recently remodeled, and was very nice. It was in a convenient location to many things including shopping and restaurants. The room was very comfortable. We ate breakfast at the restaurant and it was wonderful. We would stay there again.

review.title: JW San Fran
review.reviewText: Excellent Location, Great Staff, Large Rooms!!!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Never having been to San Francisco before, we had no clue where to book for a leisure trip! Our research paid off and we were thrilled with the location and quality of the hotel. Union square is a transportation hub so lots of easy way to get places. THe hotel was first rate! Great service. Awesome advice from the concierge. Love the iced tea/coffee bar in the lobby. Such a treat. The room was good too, but the bed was firm. Not so much that it was uncomfortable. They really made us feel special and we'd love to go back!

review.title: Perfect hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! Rooms were way more then i could have expected. Lg lcd tvs in the room with hd channels. The bed was so comfy bed. Bathrooms comes with both tub and stand up shower.Hotel was close to the "mall area" of san fran. Also just up the street u can catch the trolly to fishermans wraf. Its also walking distance to pier 39 if u can handle the hills. Alot of resturants and cafes near hotel! HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE. Will come back again

review.title: I was impressed on the hotel it's self and staff
review.reviewText: Construction work, no ice machines had to call room service if you needed more ice,impressed with the bed turn down service

review.title: Overall, pretty good
review.reviewText: The hotel room was nice - great bathroom. Location was great - very close to Union Square, clubs, Chinatown. The "butler" service was a little slow (we requested ice for our room, but it took over 30 mins.)

review.title: Understated Luxe
review.reviewText: The hotel met all of our expectations and then some. The room was very nice with a very roomy bathroom, a tub and a separate shower. The flat screen LCD TV was great and the beds comfortable. We tried room service twice and the pricing was normal for room service and food was great. One of our room service breakfasts took over 45 minutes to deliver even though we filled out the order form the night before and requested it by 7:00. The staff apologized and did not charge us...no negotiations necessary...very nice experience. The staff was very helpful and courteous. I never got the impression that they were waiting for a tip..in fact they almost seemed surprised at tips for normal activities such as hailing cabs. The staff provided a very nice gesture for our 9yr old son. All in all it was a great stay. Our family enjoyed the hotel very much.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is great except the beds have a down duvet that I could not get comfortable under. I was too hot when it was on and too cold without it. However, the hotel did provide a blanket upon request. Otherwise, everything was perfect. Staff is friendly and location can't be beat. Complimentary bottled water is a nice touch.

review.title: I will go back
review.reviewText: Excellent, everything was perfect, could not ask for more, great location, fabulous consierge.

review.title: $ 45 per day parking
review.reviewText: I am not happy that a hotel you have to pay for parking

review.title: Comfortable and Classy near Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel was under construction, but still well-maintained. All we really got to see was the room, but it was enough! From the down pillows/comforter to the flat screen tv, to the marble-covered, mirrored beautiful bathroom--it was a divine place to stay! It was a little pricey, but well worth it for the excellent customer service! Very beautiful place to stay & convenient walking distance to all the finest stores in Union Square as well as the streetcar stop and the BART station on Market! ;D

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: This hotel is very well located and has very confortable rooms.

review.title: Great hotel, but make sure you stay on a high floor
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, the bathtub was a nice treat after walking up and down the hills all day in the cold weather. The bed was soft and one of the best hotel beds I have ever slept in. The only thing is that even on the 7th floor we heard sirens and horns honking all night. The next day the staff was able to move us up to the 12th floor and we didn't hear anything that night. We had the concierge place reservations for us at a restaurant and then when we had dinner that night we were greeted with an appetizer complements of the concierge. It was extremely nice.

review.title: Just wonderful and relaxing.
review.reviewText: Just wonderful and relaxing. Room service as well as room keeping were supurb and the room and bed were heavenly,better than home!

review.title: Loved the JW
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great - just blocks away from China Town and Union Square. Great restaurants and shopping within walking distance. Disappointed that there was room service for breakfast only and no lounge. Enjoyed the hot apple cider in the lobby.

review.title: Great location & room
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel for its location, but it also turned out to have very good room (with a big bath tub!). Also, the staff who dealt with us were very friendly and helpful. We are planning to stay there again when we go back to San Francisco in a couple of months.

review.title: Exceptional value
review.reviewText: This hotel is well located. Near BART and the cable cars. Excellent Restraunts in the area. The Suite was large, spacious, and clean. Bedding was to die for. Loved our stay.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location- only 2 blocks from Union Square and bus/trolly stops. Room was very comfortable, spacious and, most importantly, clean. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Would highly recommend for business or for pleasure.

review.title: Amazing for the price
review.reviewText: I've stayed at many hotels in SF, always found and booked online. This is the best for the money I paid. The staff was great, the rooms were beautiful, clean and comfortable. I was shocked at how great it was for the money. Will definitely book my next stay in SF there.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel - many restaurants, bars and attractions in walking distance. A little far from the pier attractions, which is too bad because we ended up riding cabs a few times. Overall an excellent hotel.

review.title: Can't say enough , it was fabulous!
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with this hotel. It was everything I expected from Marriott and more. The hotel was clean, the service was wonderful. They went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The location is perfect, walking distance to all shopping and great restaurants. Anywhere else we took a taxi, and it was relatively inexpensive. I would recommend this hotel, and will definitely stay their again when in San Fran.

review.title: Nice view
review.reviewText: The Marriott offered us a last-second upgrade for just a little more money to one of the best suites they offered. The bathroom had mirrors everywhere and the bedroom had a great view, was clean, and included a wet bar and a 32" LCD TV. Complaints are minor but worth noting: Limited channels offered on TV, coffee maker was as weak as the coffee provided (tasted like they spent a "dime" per serving...), toilet needed to be upgraded to something more modern - considering what visitors pay to stay in the room. The hotel put out very good hot apple cider and tangerines in the lobby in the late afternoon-evening. We never tried their restaurants because there were so many good ones in SF. We were on the 20th floor of a 21 floor hotel, with somewhat of a panoramic view of the city. The room and hotel were quiet, which made for a very good night's rest. If they would have lined up even cable channels, decent coffee and a couple of other touches, they would have received 5 stars, but realistically, the listed shortcomings we encountered on a very pricey room shouldn't have happened.

review.title: Confortable but lacking service
review.reviewText: Hotel has been through extreame makeover since recently becoming the JW marriott, Overall hotel was very comfortable and clean, but service was slow, waited an hour until 4:30 to finally check in and get room, and an additional 45min to recieve bags. Overall happy with stay

review.title: It was a very nice stay
review.reviewText: The stay in new marriott was an excelent experience. Clean, neat and centeraly located with a very helpfull personal gave my stay without any problem

review.title: Great hotel to stay in San Fran downtown
review.reviewText: I was extremely satisfied with the service and the room. We were in San Fran for 3-day trip. We have a 9-month old baby and they were extremely helpful in any requests we had, like playpen for the baby and arranging a microwave to sterilize baby's bottles. The staff is very helpful and very friendly. The room as exceptionally clean. Overall, excellent hotel to stay in. I would recommend.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This Hotel is very close to Union Square, the Cable Car line, shopping and great dining. The staff was very helpfull. They handled getting cabs, shipping large items and other needs quickly. There was a remodel being done at the time and it caused very few problems for us. I think for the price, service and great location I would love to come back again.

review.title: Good Location, excelent service
review.reviewText: It is a good Hotel and has a good location. You can walk around the hotel and enjoy San Fransisco.

review.title: Very Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, totally refurbished and very nice contemporary style. Extremly service minded employees at the hotel.

review.title: good but the mini bars are not istalled yet
review.reviewText: Great location, helpful staff, the room was a little disappointing in that the furniture that held the mini bar was a bit warn, trim was falling off and a empty space behind the door was to hold the "new mini bar".

review.title: Great hotel for business or pleasure.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice with a great staff. Close to cable car, shopping, etc. I will definitely stay there again.

review.title: gud location-sweetstaff-no self laundry no mirror
review.reviewText: 1.front desk co-operative 2.refreshin juice at reception 3.good view from 16th floor 4.good fod n restaurant 5.heart of union square-shopping-5 mins walk tram-2 mins,bart-15 mins walk 6.indian restaurants nearby 7.but..bufet breakfast not offered 8.mirror covered by tv +no full length mirror 9.3rd person in a room crapms the room

review.title: Lovely
review.reviewText: A very pleasant stay!

review.title: Excellent location and great service!
review.reviewText: We have returned to this hotel again and again because of its central location and the excellent service of the staff. The concierge is extremely helpful, booking us dinner reservations. The rooms have nice touches, like the Bose alarm clock/radio by your bedside and the flat screen TV. There is even a TV in the bathroom. You find yourself immerse in watching a show on the Discovery channel or National Geographics, as you brush your teeth, making it a much more educational pastime. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: The interior of this hotel is simply breathtaking and the rooms are designed in such a nice manner...it felt more like a small suite. There was more than enough room...we did not feel like we were bumping into each other. And a perfect location, just a short walk to Union Square and accessable to all public transportation to get where you want to go in the city.

review.title: A wonderful vacation
review.reviewText: We had a great time at this hotel and in San Francisco. The inside of the hotel was quite impressive; the staff professional and friendly. We arrived around 9:30 a.m. and our room was ready so we unpacked and headed out. The hotel is located a convenient 2 - 3 blocks from Union Square. There is a very nice restaurant in the lobby; we dined twice for breakfast; great selection, not too overpriced. The hotel Concierge arranged a trip to Napa, suggested restaurants (exceptional) made reservations, etc. Overall a great hotel. Will not hesitate to stay again.

review.title: Will stay there the next time I go back.
review.reviewText: The staff was first rate. Wonderful bar facility and the concierge was helpful in arranging for an in room massage so everyone was happy.

review.title: Elegant and Clean
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice. Only a block from Union Square and worth the very short walk. Excellent marble features in bathroom and clean room and bed. We will definitely stay here again!

review.title: Extremely warm and helpful staff
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome. the rooms were a little worn, but the hotel itself was very clean and the entire staff was extremely warm, friendly and very helpful. It is centrally located to shopping the trolley and cable cars. I would book this hotel again.

review.title: Great location, great room
review.reviewText: We are locals to the Bay Area and stayed here since we were seeing a concert. Nice, big, clean, modern rooms. We were also upgraded for free by the person whom checked us in! Everyone was friendly and accomodating. Also, you just can't beat the location to union square if you want to go out, shopping, etc. Highly recommend it!

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Loved it. Stay there.

review.title: Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was excellent. The service from the valet parkers all the way thru to the cleaning lady was superb!!! Also, it is right smack in the center of town. We walked everywhere without a problem. The entire city (tourist destinations) can be seen by taking a brisk walk or catching a trolley 2 blocks away. Excellent place to stay. Can't wait to go back.

review.title: Honeymoon in S.F.
review.reviewText: We went here for our honeymoon, having never been to S.F. I didn't know to much about the city, although I did a lot of research on it. The hotel was great they had champagne and strawberries waiting when we got there and the location couldn't have been more perfect, it was about a block from union square, which is great for relaxing and seeing the city, also we took the BART system from the airport to get to the hotel, it took around 30 minutes but is only 5 dollars vs a very expensive cab ride, it is a subway system and there are always some interesting creatures on it like any subway, but we felt safe. Overall, we would stay at the JW again it was in a prime place and very nice, the only complaint is that the rooms where a little pricey.

review.title: Nice, but a little frayed around the edges
review.reviewText: Our room was very good -- the bathrooms in particular are spectacular. The staff was also friendly and helpful, and the location was perfect. Only two disappointments: (1) our room was definitely frayed around the edges; scuff marks on the walls, scratches in the furniture, etc.; and (2) a room service tray was left in front of the room next to us for at least 12 hours before it was picked up. I'd stay there again (at least if the rates are reasonable), but there's definitely room for improvement.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel with excellent service, the staff was very helpful. If I return to San Francisco I will definitely be staying there again. Also, the location couldn't have been better.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: I looked at a lot of hotels online before deciding on the JW Marriott and we loved it! This was our first trip to San Francisco and the employees were so helpful with every question we asked. With only one wheeled suitcase, we were able to take the BART in from SFO airport to the Powell Street Station and walk a few blocks to the JWM on Post Street. The hotel is only one block from the Powell Street cable car line, as well, so we purchased 3-day passes (which more than paid for themselves in the two days we were there, besides being SO convenient!) which were good on the cable cars, buses, and MUNI train, and rode all over the city getting on and off at will. The JWM proved to be the perfect location for us.

review.title: Outstanding Staff & Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel next to Union Square. You don't have to walk far to have a great meal. This hotel is surrounded by beautiful restaurants and bars. Service was superb. We will stay here everytime we visit San Francisco.

review.title: Simple, but not too simple
review.reviewText: One of the better hotels we've encountered. Room was spacious, clean, modern. It wasn't particularly "fancy" but it had a simple elegance. Staff was helpful/friendly--great location!

review.title: Excellent choice at Union Square
review.reviewText: Went to San Fran on vacation to see the town & sights. Got a great deal for flight & hotel (7 nights) on Expedia. Our first room had a view of the building next door, so we requested a change and they accomodated (you may have to pay more for a room with a view, but we didn't). At first, we thought that there would not be enough dresser space (4 small drawers) for seven nights, but there was -- so I guess the lesson learned is that most hotels give you more dresser space than you need. Staff was very friendly, concierge was extremely helpful (we got there with only half or our activities planned and they helped us with the rest). The food was okay at San Fran prices, so we only ate at the resurant once. For the price we paid, this was a great choice.

review.title: Save money for breakfast
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel in a great location. It is very conenient to many sites in San Francisco. Highly recommended.

review.title: Fine Hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was as expected with the exception of the A/C. It bordered on uncomfortable during the day.

review.title: Great Location! Walking Distance to many attractions
review.reviewText: The JW Marriot in San Francisco is a great place to stay for either business or just a family vacation. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. If you have your own car or rent a car at the airport you will spend $42/day + tax for valet parking at this hotel with unlimited in-out privledges. The valet service was very prompt and courteous,, just call down from the room 10 mins. before you leave and your car will be waiting for you. The one thing my wife and I did not like was the large amount of homeless people throughout the whole downtown area. This is a city problem and not the hotels problem. You are walking distance from most major locations and cable cars. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Relaxing stay, Worth the price
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel from the lobby to the rooms... it was very clean and well-kept. The bed was very comfortable and with the curtains closed, the room is pitch black... perfect sleeping conditions. The bathroom was in line with the nicest hotels I've stayed at... with a nice-sized tub and glass shower (although the shower wasn't the largest). We ordered room service for breakfast and everything was fresh, delicious and delivered on-time. Service was wonderful... all of the staff were very courteous, helpful, and not condescending at all (my fiance and i are accustomed to getting more average service at nicer hotels because of our young appearances). Valet parking is overpriced but this was expected. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone willing to spend an extra few dollars for a relaxing stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Would definitely make a repeat visit.
review.reviewText: I'm difficult to please, but I was very pleased with our stay at the Marriott. The location was great, only a block from Union Square. The Hotel was very quiet, the beds comfortable, and very clean. My husband is allergic to down, and when we requested a change in the down bedding, they were there to change our room within minutes of our arrival--I've never had such good service. The parking fees ($42/night) were steep and we parked elsewhere, but they were typical of other hotels in the area. They also had great espresso coffee in the restaurant, which I don't usually find in hotels. It was worth every penny.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: In the heart of the Union Square area, this hotel offered everything we needed - comfort, price, location, service. I wouldnt hesitate a minute to stay at this hotel again during future visits.

review.title: It's cozy
review.reviewText: It has good location, near shopping area, and close to BART and MUNI station.

review.title: Fabulous Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location (shopping, restaurants, night life), super modern hotel, fantastic staff. Absolutely no complaints or negative comments.

review.title: This Hotel was Pretty Nice
review.reviewText: I'd say stay there if you dont like a lot of noise or people around all the time. There's virtually no "nightlife" within the hotel so if you're the type that wants to go elsewhere to have fun and then come back and relax, this place is great! The only real I had was the bathroom had a vent that made a rather loud noise the whole time that you couldnt shut off but you could only really hear it if you were near the bathroom. Overall, nice place but might be able to find better for the price.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: clean and comforable. 3rd floor Wireless internet was not available as stated in the services booklet. Check-out invoice contained a service charge for something I did not use.

review.title: Brought my wife along
review.reviewText: had stayed at the Pan Pacific before. Last time brought my wife along and she had a great time touring while i was working. very nice accomodations. we we both very comfortable. we had a much higher room than one of my colleagues and the view was vastly superior... ask for a room on the higher floors.

review.title: Excellent choice in the city.....
review.reviewText: I went for work and play and found this hotel met all of my needs. It's a lovely property.

review.title: nice little touches
review.reviewText: flat screen LCD TVs, TV in bathroom, big bathroom w/seperate shower, turndown service

review.title: Our favorite place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Pan Pacific - now JW Marriott - three times within the last 24 months for both leisure and business travel. The change to JW Marriott happened the weekend we arrived and the transition appeared to be seamless, same excellent quality service, food and accommodations. When our room lacked a CD player the engineer arrived within 10 minutes and installed a DVD/CD player. The fit menu at the 3rd floor Pacific Restaurant on premiuses provides outstanding breakfast and lunch dietary options. The only minor objection there is the frayed look of the restaurant. Window dressing is tired and looks out to adjacent buildings through dirty windows with little relief. Perhaps Marriott's infusion of cash will tackle the restuarant appearance first thing. Even so, the chef, cuisine and excellent service kept us returning at least for breakfast or lunch when we had so many other options within the city.

review.title: great service
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, and great service...

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Suggest asking for a room on 10th-20th floors when you check in - these will be above the adjacent roof lines and will have a better view. Conveniently located to Union Square - many great restaurants within walking distance.

review.title: Absolutly wonderful
review.reviewText: In the heart of San Francisco, you can walk just about anywhere. The hotel was new, fresh, clean and very attentive. Quality rooms & service. We stayed for 7 days and wanted to stay longer.

review.title: We would love to stay there again
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfectly located. We walked to Union Square, Chinatown, and the Financial District. The hotel was gorgeous and provided us with any and all amenities that we needed. A definite plus on our book!

review.title: Pan Pacific
review.reviewText: Elecgant hotel!

review.title: Very Expensive!!!
review.reviewText: Very Expensive

review.title: Very Expensive!!!
review.reviewText: Very Expensive

review.title: I'll be back....
review.reviewText: I love this hotel! Not only is it beautifully decorated and conveniently located, but the service here is outstanding. I look forward to every visit at the Pan Pacific.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, not one of the mega cookie cutter hotels

review.title: impressive!
review.reviewText: i did not expect the hotel to be as nice as it was. my girlfriend and i were very pleased. we would highly recommend this hotel to all our friends and family if the every travel to san francisco.

review.title: great staff
review.reviewText: What a great stay, the staff sets itself apart from the rest of SF hotels. Highly recommended

review.title: Pleasant
review.reviewText: The hotel is at a great location and is luxurious. The concierge was wonderful and very helpful. I was disappointed is the size of the King bed. It really was not a king size at all. I ordered an 8 oz of milk for my toddler through room service and couldn't beleive my eyes when the bill read a $7.50. The breakfast at the restaurant was edible, but not recommended.

review.title: Nice place to stay very convienient location
review.reviewText: ONly thing I would point out is that the hotel restauant is a little expensive and service was not that good . There are many choices in the San Francisco area I would explore them

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I wasn't sure what area of San Francisco to stay in, but this was it. Pan Pacific is walking distance to great shopping, dining and the theatre. It was an easy drive to other attractions. The staff was wonderful, very curtious and helpful. We felt like royalty!

review.title: Great location and amenities
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel staff was very responsive to any requests. Used the town car to get to the ferry building. Also, for a fee, used the town car to get to the airport. If you need ice, you have to use the butler - average wait 10 minutes. Minor complaint is that the shower is very small in the rooms with tub. Did not eat in the restaurant, but did have room service and it was fine.

review.title: Beware
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Our only problem was at check-in. We were not given the hotel room we had paid for, but a room two classes lower than ours. I realized the problem as soon as I saw the room, but had quite a time convincing the front desk that there was, indeed, more than one room size. They tried to stonewall me, but I was persistent. I finally got the room I had paid for. The staff were all fine the rest of the stay.

review.title: Great value for money
review.reviewText: Great location and very central for San Francisco shopping, theatre etc. The biggest drawback is the confusing entrance to the hotel. You enter through the motor court and there are no signs to tell you where the reception desk for check-in is. You have to go up 2 floors and then round the elevators to find the reception area.

review.title: Understaffed non-union hotel
review.reviewText: As an example, we went to the hotel restaurant for a late breakfast at 9:30am. There was one other person eating but only one other available table- none of the other 20-30 tables had been bussed yet. We were informed by the waitperson that he hadn't time yet to clean the other tables- they have no busboys. There are many other fine hotels in the area that would be a better bet.

review.title: will deffinately go gack
review.reviewText: The only thing I was not happy with was that we could hear a lot of noise on the street.. Even though we were on the 11th floor we could hear trash trucks early in the morning and the door man wisling for taxis.. Other than that, beautiful hotel.. Great location.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: This hotel looks grand, but the staffing is not up to par. We had to wait to drop off the car, then had to wait to pick it up. Additionally, the shower barely had enough pressure to push the water out the shower head and the it wasn't cleaned properly either.

review.title: Pan Pacific
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay good value

review.title: Great Location, Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: We loved our room. It was cozy, clean and comfortable. Although it was small, it was not cramped. We had a view of the Golden Gate bridge from our window. The service is great. Because of the central location, we could go out in the morning, come back, rest and go back out in the afternoon without wasting any time getting to and from the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants elegant comfort close to lots of shops and restaurants at a fairly reasonable price.

review.title: phone calls
review.reviewText: I called to the personal valet service serveral times but was only to get them on the phone 1 time. I also called front desk, housekeeping and no one ever answered the phone.

review.title: Nice Hotel wiht Terrible Service
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location - near Union Square in San Francisco. Unfortunately the service leaves a great deal to be desired. For example I called for directions to a local theater but the concierge was not available and did not call back for over an hour - after we had left. Valet service was supposed to be in included with our "Deluxe" room but when i called no one every responded?? One additionl note - though the room's bathroom was quite large there was virtually no counter top space - very odd sink and mirror layout. Nice room - terrible service.

review.title: Very nice room, the loby is very prety and I love the elovaters
review.reviewText: Same as title Very nice room with a prety loby and the elovaters are out of this world fun.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice. The concierge was fabulous. The rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms were large.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, no pool, overall, great experience, enjoy.

review.title: Diamond in the rough
review.reviewText: Great location, just steps from Union Square! The bathroom is very large, bed is comfortable and cool flat screen TV!

review.title: A good place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little cold atmospherically, but the service is good, and it has an excellent restaurant. The rooms are nice, and have some modern amenities like HDTV and tv in the bathoom.

review.title: Will always try to stay here
review.reviewText: I have stayed in other hotels in the Union Square district and they are so small and cramped. I did not feel this at all.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff. Wonderful room

review.title: Among SF's best hotels.....
review.reviewText: Courteous staff and perfect location. The room was a little worn, but it didn't detract from our stay.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: The only complaint is not enough staff......couldn't check out at 11am....only one person at the desk and no less than 5 people trying to check out. Luckily I had pre-paid....

review.title: This has become our Favorite hotel in S.F.
review.reviewText: The staff is impressive. They look after all your needs and you feel Special all the time you are there.

review.title: Unimpressed
review.reviewText: Given the options in San Francisco, the Pan Pacific just doesn't meet muster. Below average room service (breakfast never showed up), little style, mediocre amenities. Only the price was appealing.

review.title: Better than Expected
review.reviewText: I visited from Canada and was very happy with this hotel. It exceeded my expectations and was a fair price relative to the other top tier properties. Would stay there for sure next time.

review.title: First Rate Hotel!
review.reviewText: We only stayed there one night, but the facility is excellent. Located only two blocks from Union Square, there is plenty of action and dining in the neighborhood. There's a button for your butler (I wish we had called him for something just for the fun of it!), and the bathrooms were exquisite!

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: covenient to Union Square

review.title: Very nice room
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here for four nights recently and it is definitely one of the best business class hotels in the City. Extremely satisfied, really enjoyed the bathrooms.

review.title: Friendly Staff! Will stay again!!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location. The staff was very friendly and helpful with local info. Will stay here again on our next visit!

review.title: Great central location & extremely helpful staff
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent 4 days at the Pan Pacific on our honeymoon and it was great. The room was very nice, comfortable and quiet with a decent view of downtown SF. The concierge staff was excellent and very helpful with everything we requested. The location is great. 2 blocks from Union Square, a short walk to Nob Hill or Chinatown and only 3-4 blocks from Market St and all the public transit options to get you all around the city. Plus there are many theaters and enough good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, you could see a different show every night for a week and eat at different restaurants every night. Ask the concierge about which restaurants to go to, they lead us to some excellent, yet reasonably priced, places! We'd go back to the Pan Pacific in a heartbeat.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and is close to the center of San Francisco.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location with shopping in walking distance. Central glass elevators and comfotable rooms. Would stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice and was in a great spot.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Elegant and clean.

review.title: Nice location but dont eat there....
review.reviewText: The Pan has aged and is nolonger the star that it used to be. The restaurant was drastically over priced $9.50 for a bottle of sparkling water? A very small wine list, and service that was efficent but nothing more. Money would have been beter spent elsewhere. The rooms are nice but there are better for the same price or lower. If you get a deal like we did then by all means enjoy the room. If not keep looking, in SF there are plenty of hotels to find a deal.

review.title: Great Hotel! Will go back in the future.
review.reviewText: The Pan Pacific is a very comfortable and elegant room for the price range. We will certainly be sure to book this hotel again on our next trip to San Francisco. The staff was extremly friendly and courteous. The only complaint would be the very expensive room service. I recommend eating at any of the great restaurants downtown.

review.title: Hotel people are very kind
review.reviewText: I recomend this hotel due to its location, its helpfull people and also the quality of the room

review.title: Comfort and relaxation
review.reviewText: the best place to get away from it all and not be bothered. service was the best i have had so far. i rate this hotel a A+++++++++

review.title: Beautiful hotel with a wonderful staff
review.reviewText: Although the room was a bit on the small side, the amenities and beauty of the hotel and room more than compensated for it. The staff were unfailingly polite and yet comfortable to be around, and we had a wonderful time there. I'd go back any time I could afford to stay at a nicer hotel in the Union Square area.

review.title: Pan Pacific was excellent
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with this hotel...luxury room was large and comfortable and quiet (12th Floor) great bathroom with TV, service was excellent, close to everything. Would highly recommend.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: It had a great location, close to china town and trolly cars. Room service was good, but too expensive. We paid extra for a Luxury King Suite and were a little disappointed, no TV in the bath room and the room looked a little worn.

review.title: A relaxing stay
review.reviewText: The Pan Pacific Hotel is a very stylish hotel with a friendly staff. We had the same maid our entire stay and she was very thorough. The only thing that would have made it better would be having a terrace.

review.title: more than expected
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel based on previous travelers' comments posted on this site. I found their comments more reliable than the hotel's claims. I have to say what I experienced by staying at the hotel was more favorable than what's being said, in all aspects, so I want to give it one more positive vote.

review.title: Very Nice, Very Clean
review.reviewText: This was our first time to visit San Francisco for my wife and I. There we're many choices but in the end I would recommend this hotel. The hotel staff was very helpful especially the concierge staff. Great location for downtown shopping and easy access to all other points of interests.

review.title: Bad Old Hotel
review.reviewText: stay here was a nightmare from check in to check to out.2 rooms all bad no view nothingspecial!old style for people who do donw better. I highly recommend staying else where.Breuk !

review.title: Love this hotel !!!
review.reviewText: I got to the hotel at 9 am from the airport but the front desk was nice enough to sign me in. The room was great - nice deco, elegent. The bed is incredibly comfortable and the bathroom is just beautiful, with separate tub and shower. The doormen were very friendly, give you instance warmth when you come back to the hotel.

review.title: Definitely going back!
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotelfor 5 nights with my boyfriend for our 3-year anniversary a couple of weeks ago. We had an amazing time. Our room was clean and comfortable. Great bed, great bathroom. AND - Much to boyfriend's delight, the SAN ANTONIO SPURS were staying at the hotel while we were, very exciting. The hotel staff was always helpful when we had questions or even when we were just coming and going. They also were very accomodating when we arrived early in the morning they kept our stuff until we could check in and did the same when we checked out. Not to mention, this is the best location you could ask for. Would definitely recommend this to anyone and will definitely go back!

review.title: Should have been great !!!!
review.reviewText: Quite frankly the weel stay was a nightmare from check=in to check out. I highly recommend staying else where.

review.title: What a great value
review.reviewText:
I had read from other travelers how great the service was and I have to say that I agree.  Whether it was getting directions or ideas for places to eat from the concierge, or requesting our complimentary shoe shine everyone was courteous, quick, and friendly.  We also had a problem with our TV and the gentleman from engineering was at our door within 5 minutes after we made the call.  

The location of the hotel is also good with plenty of excellent places to eat within walking distance.  We recommend the City Grill and Max's, both about 2 blocks away.  Of course Union Square is just down the street with all the shopping you could want.

The only thing I would say was disappointing was the fact that they have no pool to swim in.  The fitness center is nice with state-of-the-art equiptment however.

Overall we had a great time and would stay again.  We felt it was the best value of all the similiarly rated hotels we looked at for this trip.

review.title: Could have been great...
review.reviewText:
Spend last weekend at the Pan Pacific. Got the "Luxury king"
room which was supposed to have been a 600 sq ft upgraded deal. Our room overlooked a construction site and was very noisey. When we asked to get our room changed they took very good care of us and moved us to the one of the top floors. Very nice room. The concierge took excellent care of us and got us great seats for a show at the Curran theatre. All in all is was a very good experience. Just make sure they don't try to pawn a crummy room off on you.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The Pan Pacific is very convientely located, close to the prime shopping area, Union Square, and also to the trolley line that takes you up San Francisco's hills to the Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: can't wait to go back!!!
review.reviewText: Beautifully appointed, fabulous service, accomodating staff!Great deal thru expedia!!!

review.title: Very Helpful
review.reviewText: We had read reviews regarding the "snootiness" of the staff at Pan Pacific.  We did not find this to be true; on the contrary, the staff were friendly, helpful, and well-informed.   We obtained assistance booking restaurant reservations, a tour to Muir Woods, and directions with street cars and cable cars, all of which we found invaluable.

review.title: Pan Pacific
review.reviewText: The room was nice and comfortable. It was a great place to come back to after shopping and wine tasting. The bed was extra comfortable. I think the only realy problem we had was that there is no CD player in the room. When we tried to ask for one its $15 a day to rent one. The radio they had in the room was nice but it wasn't a CD player.

review.title: Pan Pacific Hotel - San Francisco: A Solid Choice
review.reviewText:
I only stayed one night, but I was impressed with my room, the hotel itself and the staff.  The only knock: I tried to order room service at 9:30 pm and couldn't get anyone to answer (they ultimately called back 20 minutes later after I complained to the concierge).

I have stayed in at least 10 different hotels in the Downtown/Union Square area over the past 5 years and this was the best: All of the rooms are exterior rooms and the central location is great.  If Expedia has a good price going for this hotel, stay here as you won't regret it.

review.title: GO BACK!
review.reviewText: Best hotel I ever stayed at in San Francisco. Well worth the extra $$$.

review.title: Great Location, Quiet, Elegant
review.reviewText: The hotel is an easy one block walk from Union Square and the cable car lines.  The atmosphere is elegant and very quiet.  Our Luxury King room was spacious and well-appointed, with a very comfortable bed.  The staff was friendly and helpful, though service was slow at times.  Valet parking was convenient but very expensive.

review.title: feel pampered in SF
review.reviewText:
Room amenities are a must! Details like an unbrella for rainy days show how much the hotel cares for their customers. And nice robes, delicious bath bubbles, TV on the toilet, custom-made pillows and soft sheets, make us feel like staying in the room.  Location is great!
The only down side was the US$ 42.- per night parking.

review.title: best 4-star hotel value
review.reviewText: perfect location, helpful staff, relatively affordable for the hotel class.

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in a good location. Rooms were very nice and hotel staff were very nice and helpful.

review.title: very pleasant experience
review.reviewText:
superb hotel one block from union square.  excellent door service....bags taken directly to your room.  personal valet service in room, could be a little faster at times, but good service.  wonderful bathroom and robes!  bed very comfortable.

food and bar service a little pricey...but many good spots nearby.

review.title: Very enjoyable and classy Hotel!
review.reviewText: Very enjoyable and classy Hotel!

review.title: Good hotel in heart of the city
review.reviewText: This hotel is getting a little old, but still has a nice shine to it.  Hotel staff is very helpful and the concierge was able to line us up a nice New Years Eve location for dinner on New Years Eve!  Location is great - walking distance to all kinds of things in SF.  Short/inexpensive taxi ride to everywhere.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We've stayed in many hotels all over the world & many in San Francisco.  This is our ultimate favorite hotel.  As close to perfection as you can get!

review.title: Pan Pacific - Best in SF
review.reviewText: Excellent room, with modern amenities.  Great location and friendly staff.  Highly recommended.

review.title: Comfort in Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Pan Pacific hotel for our honeymoon.  The staff and service was excellent.  The beds and bed linen  were very comfortable.  We would definately stay there again.

review.title: Very convenient, pleasant, quiet hotel
review.reviewText: Central Atrium style hotel with nice looking lobby and restaurant areas. Great location, being one block off Union Square. Did not seem very busy. Rooms are clean quiet and decently furnished, but overall feeling was fairly sterile. Bathrooms are well appointed. Overall, above average, but not spectacular. Good value.

review.title: Review of the Pam Pacific Hotel
review.reviewText: We love the location and the hotel itself.  We have been going to the hotel for the past ten years.  The service and friendliness was not like in the past.  The condition and cleanliness was as good as ever.

review.title: Wonderful location, beautiful hotel, uneven service
review.reviewText: You cant beat the location and the entire hotel is  spotless. The maid service is the best I have ever seen, the same goes for the doormen and bellman.  The front desk and concierge staff ranged from helpful to too full of themselves to be bothered. It seemed to depend upon who was on duty.  We found it rather strange that in a suite that the refrigerator was mounted on a furniture cart that looked as if it had just come from a thrift store.  The bar and hotel dining are excellent. room service was slow and a special request to have champaign waiting in the room was ignored.  This is an excellent hotel and well worth a visit, but, the service  is not what it is claimed to be. Still, it is an excellent value .  The Beds are incredibly good.   It can be a bit noisy at the lower levels but not bad for a city hotel. The windows really need cleaning, on the outside

review.title: Great location, Excellent Staff
review.reviewText: My wife and I(we're both in our late 20's to give a better idea)stayed at the hotel on Thanksgiving weekend this year (2004).The hotel is very elegant.The room was very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable.The sheets were extremely clean and smelled great.The bathroom was another highlight.Seperate shower and bath, all marble, very clean.There is also a small TV in the bathroom.Other important features are a high speed internet access, and also through the television if you did not bring a laptop.The safe was easy to use and can fit a laptop computer if needed.The hotel staff were very friendly.Arguably,the best feature of the hotel is the concierge service.The people at the concierge desk were very helpful and we loved every places they recommended.They are mostly in their 30's and have recommendations for older and younger age groups.I loved that they recommended places that were local favorites as opposed to overcrowded touristic places.They booked tours for us, arranged a rental car, etc, all without me leaving the hotel.The hotel has a car that can drop you off where you would like to go,and this is available on a first come first serve basis with no reservations(it's a free service, but you are expected to tip the driver).We had to wait approx 15 minutes for the driver on average.The drivers are very polite and helpful as well.The Pan Pacific is an excellent hotel at a reasonable price.

review.title: Would go back in a minute
review.reviewText: centrally located .Walking distance to main attractions

review.title: good location, decor may not be to everyone's taste
review.reviewText:
Stayed here in November 04 for a quick weekend trip. The room was small but comfortable -- vaguely Asian in style and a bit dated; a bit too 80s for my personal taste (especially the bathroom!) but well maintained. The hotel itself is built around an atrium, which makes the public areas somewhat noisy. 

An odd quirk: There are no ice machines, so if you want ice, you have to have an employee get it for you. I presume that this is the result of wanting to pamper guests, but personally I resented having to tip (and wait!) for a service that I was perfectly happy to do myself. 

Good location, just far enough from Union Square to be "off the beaten path" but close enough so it's not a long haul to get there.

review.title: Disatisfied Travler
review.reviewText: My Husband left his wedding ring in the hotel, one morning and when we returned from a day of shopping it was no where to be found.  Called the housekeeping Mgr. on duty, and spoke to security, no resolution, or contact from upper Management to date!

review.title: The Pan Pacific Hotel is absolutey wonderful!!!!!!
review.reviewText: My husband and I loved the hotel!  It was actually our first time being in San Francisco.  The hotel is right in the middle of "everything!!!"  We were so happy!  The staff was so very wonderful and helpful.

review.title: Review of Pan Pacific in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
My sister & brother-in-law were also staying at the hotel. He accidently left his wedding ring on the bathroom counter, when we got back to the room, the ring was gone, the manager did not seem to show a lot of concern.
So I don't believe I would stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Amazing!
review.reviewText: The beds were incredible.  I wish I could have taken it with me!  The service and accomidations were outstanding!

review.title: Weekend getaway
review.reviewText: My wife and I just visited San Francisco for a weekend and had a wonderful time.  The Pan Pacific is a beautiful hotel with all the comforts and ammenities of a 5 star hotel.  The concierge was very friendly and helpful.  We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to San Fran.

review.title: Great location and great staff!
review.reviewText: The hotel is right in the heart of Union Square...which left you limitless in activities.  Additionally, the concierge staff were so helpful with everything.  The room itself was excellent. Clean, roomy and really comfy bed. The bathroom is huge and the room comes equipped with an lcd tv.  Would recommend it to anyone stopping by the San Francisco area.

review.title: Pan Pacific Hotel
review.reviewText: This was an exceptional find for the price.  The room was exquisite with all of it's amenities and perks.  The view was beautiful, especially at night with the city skyline.  It's conveniently located for shopping at Union Square or catching the cable car down to the wharf.  Also nice was the complimentary limo service that the hotel provided.  We had a delightful stay for our 15th. Anniversary Trip.

review.title: Pan Pacific perfect location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is perfect and central to Union Square. The hotel is comfortable and the service was great. I would not take my children there as it really is a more adult oriented hotel. It was perfect for business though and central to everything.

review.title: Pan Pacific, San Francisco
review.reviewText: 4- star business hotel conveniently located downtown very near Union Square and the shopping district.  Facilities, food, room service, (and prices) consistent with overall rating.  Bell Captian and staff superb, luggage handled incredibly efficiently, connections with limo services seamless.  Reception staff quite polite but points off for lack of followup concerning a reservation glitch.  A pool would be nice.  Not a "view' hotel.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel.  Room was nice and bathroom lacked space for two.  Have always liked hotels that allowed two to get ready at same time in bathroom-meaning that I prefer two wash basins.  This had one.  Other than that it was a nice stay.
